loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a farm where she grows french beans. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a productive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price changes. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family's well being. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a seasoned smallholder dairy farmer from Nyamira area of Kenya. He is married and has 4 children in school. He started farming from scratch 30 years ago. Today, he owns 2.5 acres of land which he keeps 3 cows, 14 hens, 2 goats, coffee, tea and over 600 trees.
 
Kennedy wants to maintain the growth of his business for his future generation to enjoy. He is at a point where he needs your help: He is seeking a loan to buy farm tools, poultry and to construct a cowshed. This loan investment aims to grow his current business and improve production. 
Kennedy hopes to make enough off this investment to meet the basic needs of his family and education for his children.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, expand his poultry business and construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en:
Nuriat (first from the left) is a female aged 34, married with five children and a resident of Kyalanga village, Kyalanga parish. She leads a group of five farmers in her village. She is a farmer who majorly grows sweet potatoes, bananas, cassava, and soya beans. She also rears goats and chickens and has a goat. She earns her income through the sale of crop products. 

Nuriat and the group have suffered low yields from their crops for a long time. This is because they lacked knowledge on good farming and they have not capital to invest in their farming ventures. Having attained several trainings on farming as a business organized by YICE, Nuriat and her friends have gained practical knowledge and skills on better farming. They are therefore requesting for the loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seedlings in order to boost their productivity the coming farm season. 

Nuriat’s dream is to become main supplier of foodstuffs to schools in her community and hopes to use this loan to achieve her goal. With increased income, Nuriat will buy new land to expand her garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seedlings in order to boost their productivity the coming farm season.

loans.name: Specioza's Group

texts.en:
Specioza is a small-holder farmer growing maize, cassava, sweet potatoes, ground nuts and beans. She also rears goats, pigs and chicken. Specioza earns her income through the sale of farm products and hand-craft mats she makes. 

Specioza mobilized and leads a group of four fellow member farmers who actively participate in trainings organized by YICE on farming as business. She and the group recognized that their farm output has always been limited by poor quality seeds, resistant weeds and the use of poor tools that damage crops. They now ask for a small loan to purchase good quality seeds, herbicides and modern tools in order to increase their productivity. 

Specioza’s dream is to become a model farmer and inspire other community members to put much more emphasis on farming as a source of income and food.

loans.use: to purchase good quality seeds, herbicides and modern tools in order to increase the group's productivity.

loans.name: Ibrahim's Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim (second from the right) is a smallholder farmer and a resident of Kyalanga village in Kasese district. Ibrahim is 33 years old and married with four children. He mainly grows maize, coffee, beans, and cabbages. He also rears goats, sheep, and has a cow. Ibrahim earns his income through the sale of crop products.

Ibrahim mobilized a group of five farmers to join YICE’s farming as business program. These have been trained on better farming methods, financial management, and group formation. They have acquired new skills on crop growing and look forward to put these skills into practice. 

Ibrahim and his group members are requesting a small loan to purchase farm inputs and tools and to expand their gardens. Members plan to use the income from their crop products to pay for this loan after harvesting.

Ibrahim’s dream is to educate all his children to university and plans to establish a farm input shop.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, tools, and expand their gardens

loans.name: Amos' Group

texts.en:
Amos (first from the left), aged 42, is a male, married with seven children. He lives in Kabarodi village, Kanamba parish. He is a farmer who mainly grows coffee, beans, groundnuts, and bananas. He also rears animals such as goats, sheep, and rabbits, and birds such as chickens. He earns his income through the sale of crops and animal products.

Amos mobilized his farmer group to benefit from YICE’s trainings and financial support. Amos and his group have attended YICE’s trainings in farming as business, and record-keeping, and now they are confident they can improve their farm yields. However, they lack enough capital to buy fertilizers, good-quality seeds, and herbicides for their farms. That is why they requested a loan in order to buy these farm inputs so as to improve their crop productivity.

Amos’ dream is to become a model farmer in his community, and he believes working with YICE would help him achieve this goal.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, good-quality seeds, and herbicides for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more skirts and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Bukuru Sung-Bagurugu Group

texts.en:
Fati is a 38-year-old hard working woman from Bagurugu, in the northern region of Ghana. She is married, with 5 children. Fati is the person pictured sitting with the hand raised and a basin of shea nuts in front of her in the midst of her group mates. Fati is a member of a shea nuts and butter processing group that has been in business for close to ten years. 

The name of the group is ‘Bukuru sung, Bagurugu’. She earns a good profit from the business, as the group had been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process premium shea butter for the local and export markets. Fati and ‘Bukuru sung, Bagurugu’ have requested for a loan of GHS 12,000.00. Fati’s share of the loan is GHS 500.00 which she would use to buy shea nuts for processing. She wants to earn more income to repay this loan and help support her children in school. Fati is very grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing, to make a good income and pay for schooling for her children

loans.name: Paraiso De Jesus Group

texts.es: Olga es una mujer emprendedora de 22 años con un bebe de 9 meses, vive con sus padres y hermanos quienes la ayudan en el negocio porque su bebe todavía esta muy pequeño, ella cuenta con un negocio de bazar que puso gracias a su madre que le enseñó como debe emprender el negocio. Desde hace 2 años Olga trabaja de 8.00 de la mañana hasta las 4.00 de la tarde con la ayuda de su familia. Le gusta atender su negocio porque le ayuda a socializar con sus clientes, sus principales clientes son sus amigos y vecinos que viven cerca a su casa, en su bazar vende todo tipo de plástico como vasos, jarras, platos y también productos de belleza, El préstamo que solicito lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería como vasos de plástico, platos y otros similares. Ella busca darle una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeño bebe, Olga pertenece al grupo "Paraiso de Jesus" que fue formado por un grupo de 6 vecinos emprendedores que desean crecer mas en sus negocios, ella agradece el prestamos que le otorgó Edaprospo y a Kiva. Ella dice sentirse feliz y agradece la ayuda que recibe de los Inversionistas Kiva y pide que ayuden siempre a gente que desea salir adelante como ellos.
texts.en:
Olga is an enterprising woman, aged 22, who has a nine-month-old baby. She lives with her parents and siblings, who help her with the business because her baby is still very young.

Olga has a gift shop that she set up thanks to her mother, who taught her how to run this business. For two years, Olga works with the help of her family, from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. Olga likes taking care of her customers because it is a way to socialize with her customers and friends. Her main customers are her friends and neighbours. In her gift shop she sells beauty products and plastic products such as glasses, pitchers, and plates. 

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as plastic glasses, pitchers, containers, dishes, and the like.  She is looking to give her baby a better quality of life. 

Olga is a member of the "Paraiso de Jesus" group. This group was formed by six enterprising neighbours, who want to grow their businesses.

Olga is grateful to Edaprospo for the loan and to Kiva.

She says that she is happy and grateful for the help she receives from Kiva lenders, whom she asks to keep on helping people who want to get ahead like her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as plastic glasses, pitchers, containers, dishes, and the like.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables and maize, and also keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a productive place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

Her business goal is to have a large-scale farm within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Winfrida

texts.en:
Winfrida is 54 years old, married and supports four children. She is a small-scale farmer and grows cash crops and also keeps livestock.
 
She will use this loan to buy a dairy cow and get milk to sell to her customers and hopes this will enable her to generate more income to support her family. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and plans are to expand her farming and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and get milk to sell to her customers and hopes this will enable her to generate more income to support her family.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a forty four year old married woman living in Irbid. She has started a small business inside her house to help her husband spend money on their five children; her business is to make wedding invitation cards.  Her husband works with low income. 

She is hoping to get the loan to buy supplies and to make good promotions for her to cover a lot of areas in Irbid.
Raeda wishes to open her own printing house.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making wedding invitation cards and to be successful enough to open her own printing shop

loans.name: Rajmonda

texts.en:
Kindly note, that Rajmonda is extremely poor; she is a divorced mother and a member of the vulnerable ethnic community of Egyptian Albanians and she needs your compassion and financial help. Rajmonda is in the photograph with her 17-year-old only child, named Dhimitraq inside their one-room family home that is about to collapse. “From the leaking of the roof, our room is filled with mold. For almost nine months a year, we are sick and our bones hurt throughout the winter. I don’t think we can survive another winter under such conditions. We really need help and we will appreciate any amount that people will lend to us. We will pay it back: We promise,” said Rajmonda to the loan officer.
 
Rajmonda works for a pay of approximately $400/month by doing cleaning in some nearby restaurants and other commercial places.

loans.use: to make some basic repairs to her poorly built one-room house

loans.name: Zaenal

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Zaenal, one of Ruma's agents. Zaenal lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about 5 hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his two children. 

Zaenal owns a stall that sells small snacks and drinks and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system, as well as to give more contribution to his community. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Zaenal needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Zaenal’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later on, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

As seen in the photo, Zaenal is the one who is standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his local community better access to communication service by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Fady

texts.en:
Fady is married and has 3 children. A year ago, Fady opened a café to guarantee a constant income and better living conditions for his family. The cafe became the only source of income to the family. 

A 5000 EGP helps Fady buy 2 LCDs to attract more customers to his café, especially when football leagues are on TV.

loans.use: buy 2 LCD's (Liquid Crystal Television) for his cafe to attract more customers, especially when football is being shown

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Janet (first from the left) is a resident of Kabaka Village, Karusandara parish, aged 37, and married with six children. She is a farmer who grows crops like coffee, bananas, vegetables, and millet, and keeps animals like cattle, sheep, and pigs. She earns her income through sale of crops and animal products.

Janet, with her group members, have attended three YICE trainings on farming as a business, and they acquired knowledge on how to do better farming and maximize profits on their farms. 

Janet and the group lack funds to buy basic farm input products like herbicide, fertilizers, and tools. That is why they are requesting a loan so as to purchase this equipment and expand their farms.

Janet and her group members plan to use the income from their farms to expand their gardens and open up new land for farming. Janet’s dream is to educate all her children to university.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides, fertilizers, and farm tools.

loans.name: Figen

texts.en:
Figen is divorced and living with her two children.  In order to take care of her children she started making dowry like her mother did. She sold her products from home or from stands.  With the help of her first loan she bought fabric for her products and sold them. With the help of her second loan she is planning to buy more materials for dowries and increase the number of her products.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Figen hanım eşinden ayrı iki çocuğu ile beraber yaşıyor.  İki çocuğuna bakmak için anne mesleği olan çeyiz işine başladı.   Evden ve stantlarda satarak evinin ekonomisini katkı sağlıyor.  Mikro krediden ilk çektiği kredi ile malzeme aldı üretti ve  sattı.  İkinci kredi ile de malzeme alacak üreterek satarak evinin ekonomisine katkı sağlayacak.

loans.use: to buy dowry materials

loans.name: Nur

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Nur, one of Ruma agents. Nur lives in South Bogor, a village located in West Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her two children, one daughter and one son. Nur owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as an informative mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Nur needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Nur’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later on, her community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

Nur is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her local community.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children and all attend school. She has no additional family members. She operates a food stall at the market on retail basis. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes. Her challenges include seasonality of food. Her dream is to buy land to start farming.She lives in her own house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utilities.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her farm is located in a productive place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Toktobubu

texts.ru: Токтобубу, 23 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 ребенка. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает уборщицей в школе, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Токтобубу занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав около 3 года назад. Благодаря упорному труду Токтобубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 9 овец. На участке, мерою 2,80 Га земли, она выращивает картофель и люцерну для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Токтобубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Токтобубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и воспитание ее детей.
texts.en: Toktobubu is 23 years old, married, and is raising a child together with her husband. She has a secondary specialist education and works as a cleaner in a school. Toktobubu rears animals and grows crops to get additional income for her family, having started about three years ago. Thanks to Toktobubu's hard work, today she has three cows and nine sheep. She grows potatoes and alfalfa for sale on a 2.8 hectare plot of land. In order to develop her business further, Toktobubu has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock to increase her herd. Toktobubu plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing her number of domestic livestock and educating her children.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Duaa

texts.en:
Duaa is 21 years old single lady; she is in her third year in university majoring statistics.

Duaa is from big educated family, and her father is retired from his work which was a teacher, she likes what she is studying and wants to work as a teacher to deliver her message and make a change.

She applied for a loan because his father could not cover her education fees, and she will use this loan to pay for her university and to buy what she needs from books and supplies for her education.

loans.use: to pay for her 3rd year university fees, where she is studying statistics and to buy books and supplies for her education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a new bathroom and toilet with concrete, to replace the current wooden structure

loans.name: Buckley School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Esther. She is the Head teacher of Buckley High Primary School, a girls school in the Urban area of Iganga with 450 students. Buckley School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatments system with two 450 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Buckley School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Esther ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Kachere Group

texts.en:
A business woman, who sells fish for her daily survival, Enelesi is aged 32 with five children of which only three go to school. She started this business in order to support her family by providing them with basic needs and to also reduce her households’ levels of poverty. 

Her purpose of getting the loan is to buy more stock of fish for her business. From the profits that she makes she later wants to open a grocery. The loans have benefited her a lot, as she is now able to provide her children with essential needs.

loans.use: to buy fish which will help her and her family escape from poverty and supply them with basic needs

loans.name: Simona Maribel

texts.es: Simona  es madre soltera con un hijo menor, ella tiene 34 años de edad egresada de la carrera de educación. Actualmente se encuentra estudiando su maestría en educación en la universidad Enrique Guzmán y Valle pasando a su tercer ciclo lo cual le va bien. Agradece a sus padres por el apoyo y la confianza brindada. Su mayor deseo es nombrarse en el Ministerio de Educación. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para el pago de su pensión y matricula. Simona se siente contente y agradece a los inversionistas kiva que  hicieron posible este crédito.
texts.en:
Simona is an unmarried mother with a child. She is 34 years old and a teaching graduate. At the moment she is in her third year of a masters in education, at Enrique Guzmán y Valle University, which is going well. She is grateful to her parents for their support and the faith they place in her. Her greatest desire is to be appointed to the Ministry of Education.

Simona will use the loan she is applying for to pay for accommodation and course enrolment fees. She feels pleased and grateful to the Kiva investors, who have made this loan possible.

loans.use: to pay for accommodation and course enrolment fees.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is 55 years old, married, and blessed with six children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for four years. He will be using the loan to lease land for farming and buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for planting and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support his family. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes are to improve his farming, make more income, and support his family.

loans.use: To lease more land for farming and also buy seeds and fertilizer to get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en: Yohana is 63 years old, married, and blessed with four children. He is a farmer; he grows cash crops to sell and also keeps livestock. He will be using the loan to buy a dairy cow and hopes this will enable him to get more milk to sell to his customers and make more income to support his family. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. His future hopes are to improve his farming methods, make more income, and support his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow in hopes this will enable him to get more milk to sell to his customers and make more income to support his family

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 46 years old, married, and blessed with three children. He has a motorcycle transport business and he will be using the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition. He hopes this will enable him to serve more customers. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition in hopes this will enable him to serve more customers.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmmoud is a caring father wants to provide good life for his children, he is very ambitious man, nothing prevents him from being a productive person in his country. 

Mahmmoud has been making sweets since 1985.  He has a small shop to sell his products and it is working well, but lately he faced financial problems that lead him to think about expanding his work and increase his products to increase his income.  That is why he applied for a loan to help him buy flour, supplies and other candy making materials which will help him to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to help him buy flour and supplies for his sweets making business, which will help him to achieve his dreams for his children

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine (first from the left) is 52, married with 6 children, and a resident of Kibuga parish, Kibuga village. She is a farmer who grows potatoes, cassava, maize, and sorghum. She also rears goats, pigs, and sheep. She earns her income through the sale of crop yields and owns a small food store in her community.

Josephine and her group members are beneficiaries of YICE’s trainings on farming as a business. The knowledge and skills acquired by the group members have enabled them to realize how profitable farming is and thus yearning to apply it. They are therefore requesting a loan to buy farm inputs like tools, fertilizers and herbicides which will boost their farm output in terms of quality and quantity.

Josephine’s dream is to construct a residential house and expand her food store business in Kibuga village. She is confident that with a Kiva loan and continued support from YICE she will be able to achieve this dream.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like tools, fertilizers and herbicides which will boost their farm productivity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a calf to let it grow and sell it later for a profit

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married with two children and attend  school. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for 4 years. 

She has applied for a loan from MCDT - SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. She generates additional income from poultry farming. She works at the market and sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include ever increasing prices of used clothes. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent ,school fees, and food.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida earns a living by selling fresh fish to people in her community. She is married and the mother of three children aged 18, 20 and 25 years old. Her husband is a fisherman, and she has been engaged in fishing for more than 20 years. She is seeking a loan to buy supplies, including a fishing net, a cage and epoxy (adhesive). These will allow her to catch and sell more fish. With this loan, her income will increase and she will be able to pay her expenses. Zenaida's goal for the future is to earn enough money to provide her children with a brighter future by paying for their education.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a fishing business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 30 years old, married to Richard and they are blessed with 5 children. She has been a small scale farmer for the last 4 year and has been selling maize, bananas and vegetables to her customers. 

She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes are to expand her farming business and support her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm  so as to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 27 years old, married to Anna, and supports two children. He has a motorcycle transport business. He will be using the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his business by buying another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition so as to serve more customers and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stocks of beans, rice, green grams and maize for sell and hopes this will enable her to make more profits and support her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm so as to get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Elesia

texts.en: Elesia is a hardworking entrepreneur and the mother of nine children. She runs a food-vending in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan from NWTF to buy more ingredients to use to make food to sell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling rice. Elesia dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 37-year-old single mother of 1. A decade ago, she started farming to help herself cover the increasing needs and expenses of her family. She has succeeded throughout the years in growing the business and gaining loyal customers. Now, her 5 acre farm has 1 dairy cow, 4 heads of poultry, 1 goat, horticulture garden and 70 trees. Flora also runs a local retail outlet that is stocked with basic household items.
 
Flora is requesting a KES 50,000 loan to grow and diversify her farm business. Here is how she plans to breakdown her expenses: KES 20,000 is to be spent on poultry, KES 20,000 on pigs and KES 10,000 on animal feed. Having pigs and more poultry will not only increase her income but also grow her product portfolio and reduce business risks.  
Flora's aspiration is to grow her farm business to increase her income and improve her family's living condition

loans.use: to buy poultry, pigs and animal feeds

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is 45 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and a mother of seven children. Her husband owns a printing shop, her husband is the guardian of family and responsible to fulfill the need of all family members. Fareeda has been running her own beauty saloon for past ten years, she also contribute her income with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brush, and other accessories for her beauty saloon but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore Fareeda has applied for Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers.  It will also helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Fareeda is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty parlor and cosmetics sales business, so as to provide a better service to her customers

loans.name: Hyrine

texts.en:
Hyrine is a 40-year-old married mother of 6 children. 23 years ago, she started farming to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family.  Currently, she is practicing dairy and poultry farming. She has succeeded throughout the years in growing the business and gaining loyal customers. 
As her children are growing up, their family needs are increasing. She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products.   
Hyrine hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living condition

loans.use: to buy poultry in order to increase her income from selling eggs and chickens

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 54 years old, married, and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ellen requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ellen has been raising pigs for 18 years now, and has borrowed 31 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Ellen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Nameuang Group

texts.en:
Maimun understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Maimun knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Maimun purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Maimun is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Maria de Carmen is 51 years old, married and has four sons, two are married and independent. She has owned a grocery store for more than 15 years and also has a small pizza restaurante. She lives with her husband who works as a mechanic.  

Maria del Carmen is asking for a loan to restock her grocery store. She says that the store has an excellent location and is very near to a public school.  Her goal is to continue to grow her business and increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is a 48 years old, married, and earns a living by raising and selling hogs. She would like to improve her life and the life of her husband, who is a farmer. To make this possible, she has requested a loan to buy feed for her pigs so that they are high-quality and able to be sold in the market. Nilda's goal for the future is to save money to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel is a 40 years old, married and has two children to provide for. As the head of his family he aims for a better living for them. To achieve this, he wants to increase his family income, so he decided to borrowe a loan to buy feed for his pigs. This will allow him to produce good quality pigs. so he can sell more pigs in the market which will create greater income.

Roel's plan for the future is to save money from his income to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 57 years old and married with four children. Merlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Merlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. She has been in this business for thirty years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries.

In the future Merlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She runs a food vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting the new loan to further build her business.

Mildred dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals for selling to support her three children as a single mother

loans.name: Joash

texts.en:
Joash is 37 years old, and he has a shoe repair business, which he has been running in Kisii town. He is married and blessed with three children. 

He will use the loan to buy shoe repair materials such as sewing threads, shoe soles, shoe laces, shoes glue and shoe leather. He hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to support his family.

He plans to use generated profits to provide food for the family and also to educate his children. His future hope is to open a shoe sales business.

loans.use: to buy shoe repair materials such as sewing threads, shoe soles, shoe laces, shoes glue and shoe leather and be able to serve more customers and make more income.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 36 years old, married and blessed with 2 children. He has a motorcycle transport business. 

He will be using the loan to buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to support his family. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition and be able him to serve more customers and make more income.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is 59 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan from NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal and home care products and other groceries. Adelaida has been in her current line of work for four years and her goal for the future is to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn is 32 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rubilyn is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rubilyn has been raising pigs for two years and also earns income from rice retailing. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Thouyyai Group

texts.en:
Mun understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Mun knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filterMun purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.   

Mun is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so her and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Döne

texts.en:
Döne is married and has a child.  She has been working since she was a child.  After she got married she worked in a public company.  She had all the financial resposibilities of her home so she had to do additional business in order to earn money.  She was interested in jewellery design and educated herself on it.  She started making money on her jewellery.  Her daughter had to go to a university in so she retired and moved  in order to be with her daughter.  Here she continued with her jewellery business.  

She is making her jewellery according to the horoscope with genuine stones.  She opened a stand by the sea.  With the help of her first loan she is planning to purchase materials for her jewels.  From now on she wants to continue her life without being in need of others.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Döne hanım evli bir çocuk annesi.  Küçük yaşlardan beri çalışıyor.  Evlendikten sonra bir devlet dairesinde çalışmaya başlamış.  Evinin bütün yükü üzerinde olduğundan çalışmanın yanında ek işlerde yapmaya başlamış.  Takı tasarımına merak sarmış, bu işi öğrenip bundan kazanç elde etmeye başlamış.  Kızı üniversiteyi kazanınca, kendi de emekli olunca kızını yalnız bırakmamak için bulunduğu şehirden göçmüş.  Burada da takı işine devam etmiş.  Hakiki taşlardan değişik tasarımlar yapıyor.  Burçlara göre kişiye özel takılar yapıyor.  Sahilde stant açıp burada satışlarını yapıyor.  Aldığı ilk kredi ile takı malzemeleri alacak.  Bundan sonra sağlıklı bir şekilde kimseye muhtaç olmadan hayatını devam ettirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her jewelry making

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley is 36 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur, especially with both of her children in school. She earns a living by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell. Shirley has been in this business for 15 years, and her goal for the future is to enough money to provide financial stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Risper

texts.en: Risper is 38 years old, married to Joel and blessed with 2 children. She is a farmer and has been in this business for 7 years. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income and support her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and be able her to get more farm produce for sale and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods and products and such as sugar, cooking oil etc so as to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Dúo La Joya De Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Dúo la Joya de Buena Vista Rebeca es la encargada de este grupo, tiene una tienda de consumo diario, y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de ropa típica variada desde hace 5 años. Su sueño es ser una gran distribuidora en su aldea de consumo diario y venta de ropa típica. Ya tiene varios pedidos de güipiles y cortes, también le faltan aguas gaseosas en la tienda por eso necesita otro préstamo para comprar y tener lleno el negocio.
texts.en: The Duo, la Joya de Buena Vista (Gem of Buena Vista): Rebeca is the manager of this group, she has an everyday consumer goods store, and as a secondary activity she has made a living selling assorted traditional clothing for the last 5 years. Her dream is to be a large distributor of everyday consumer goods and assorted traditional clothing in her small village. She has several orders for güipiles and cortes (blouses and skirts), she also needs sparkling water in the store. For this reason she needs another loan to buy them and have her business full.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (everyday consumer goods) to sell.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Nim, who is 55 years old, is living in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children. To support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, grows rice and sells the crop to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this type of business for around thirty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day. 

As a supplementary earning, she has come up with a new business idea.  She wants to raise pigs for sale. However, her insufficient capital investment doesn’t allow her to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy pigs. She hopes that this new trade will help to improve her live standard. She would like to thank to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy pigs to help support her family

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 35 years old, married and supports 4 children. She is a poultry farmer and has been rearing chicken for the last 6 years. She sells and supplies eggs and chicken to her customers and she currently makes a monthly income of KES 7,000.

Jane has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy poultry feeds such as layers mash for high eggs production and hopes this will enable her to get more eggs for supply and generate more income to support her family. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and plans are to expand her poultry farming, sell more chicken and eggs and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds such as layers mash for high eggs production and hopes this will enable her to get more eggs for supply and generate more income to support her family

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a 52-year-old married woman with six children, one of whom is in school.

Adelaida is a very hard working entrepreneur and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her business.

Adelaida has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ana Maria successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business. She dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry to increase revenue from selling eggs and chickens

loans.name: Maria Casandra

texts.en:
Maria Casandra is 26 years old, with two children. With one child in school, Maria Casandra works very hard to provide for the family.

Maria Casandra runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Maria Casandra has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Maria Casandra would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 35 years old and single. Marivic works very hard to provide for her needs.

Marivic runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, snack foods, personal care products and other groceries.

Marivic has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Marivic would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, snack foods, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 69 years old and a widow with ten children. Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rica is 33 years old and has five children who are in school.

Rica has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Rica requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Rica has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Rica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her bicycles  business

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lucila works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lucila is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, etc., for her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.

Lucila has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 32-year-old married mother of 3 children. 8 years ago, she started farming to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She practices dairy, poultry, sheep and horticultural farming. Throughout the years, she has succeeded in growing the business and gaining loyal customers. 
As her children are growing up, their family needs are increasing. She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products.   
Mary hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living condition

loans.use: to buy poultry to make income from egg and chicken sales and thus support her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition so as to serve more customers and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to apply on his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce for sale and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en:
Sokny, 43, is residing in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has six children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business in a small farmland, primarily grows rice and sells her agricultural product to local dealers and customer at the market. So far, she has been in this type of business for fifteen years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 5.00 a day. 

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of traveling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike, for a convenient way of traveling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for use on her farm, so as to get more farm produce for selling and to make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Marie Jucily

texts.en:
Marie Jucily is 43 years old, married, and has one child to provide for. To earn a living and help her husband in providing for her family, she started a market garden. She plants vegetables and sells her produce to the neighborhood and a nearby market.

She aims to increase her income for her family. She decided to borrow a loan to purchase fertilizer for the garden to produce good quality vegetables that can generate more income.

Marie Jucily's plan for the future is to buy a vehicle to use in delivering her vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the garden.

loans.name: Maria Grace

texts.en:
Maria Grace is 45 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Maria Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Maria Grace has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Maria Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Meldeth

texts.en:
Meldeth is 31 years old and married with one child. Meldeth works very hard to provide for them.

Meldeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Meldeth has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Meldeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Lorna Joy

texts.en:
Lorna Joy is a married woman with one children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna Joy is 39 years old and has one child who is in school.

Lorna Joy has a snack food vending business in the Philippines. Lorna Joy requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Lorna Joy has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lorna Joy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Risty Marie

texts.en:
Risty Marie is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Risty Marie is 22 years old and one of children in school.

Risty Marie has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Risty Marie requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

Risty Marie has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Risty Marie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her bicycle business

loans.name: Phokham Group

texts.en: Yor's village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Yor and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Yor and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Yor’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nabone Group

texts.en: Lan’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Lan and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Lan and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Lan’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Chainie

texts.en:
Chainie is 30 years old and married with three children, who are still in school. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Chainie has been in this business for seven years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain it. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Soeun, 52, is a married woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has seven children in total; three are single, while the other four are married. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and sells the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for around thirty years. She is able to make an income of USD 2.50 per day, on average.  

Recently she wants to operate one more farming business by growing cashew trees. Therefore, she would like to apply for Kiva loan to buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for her cashew plantation. With the supporting from this loan, she hopes that she can get more income and improve her living standard. She would like to thank to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for her new cashew nut trees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her two daughters to commute to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothes for sale in the market so as to meet client needs in wearing new clothes.

loans.name: Antenor

texts.es:
Antenor tiene 41 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos de 10 y 4 años los cuales cursan estudios en el colegio de la zona. Él y su familia viven en la parte rural y cuenta con servicios de luz, en el Distrito de Querocotillo, Provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, Sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza es la de servicio de transporte contando con una mototaxi en la cual realiza su labor en el caserío de Huancas y sectores aledaños, esta labor le permite solventar el crédito sin ningún problema.

El destino del crédito será para invertir en mantenimiento de vehículo y otros, así generar mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Antenor is 41 years old. He lives in his own home with his spouse and their two children, who are 10 and 4 years old and attend the local school. He and his family live in a rural area with electrical services, in the district of Querocotillo, in the province of Cutervo, in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. His business is providing transportation services with a motorcycle taxi. He works in the hamlet of Huancas and the surrounding area. His work will allow him to repay the loan without difficulty. The loan will be used to maintain this vehicle and others, so that he can earn more income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining a motor vehicle.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is thankful that she was granted a PHP 10,000 loan that she used to buy raw ingredients needed to maker her "atsara" (a Filipino version of pickle relish) and peanut butter to sell. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like now to apply for PHP 12,000, which she will use to buy ingredients such as green papaya, sugar, carrots, garlic, peanuts, oil and other items needed to make "atsara" and peanut butter. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help cover their daily sustenance. 

Mary Ann aims to sustain and grow her appetizer and sandwich spread business. She wants to save more than enough to assist her parents in their old age. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy green papaya, sugar, carrots, garlic, peanuts, oil and other items to make atsara and peanut butter.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
The lady you can see standing at the back is Conception. She's a business enthusiast. Whatever source of income she can get in touch with, she never lets go, instead, she improves. 

Recently, she availed herself of a loan for the development of her direct-selling business and it was a success. Now, she asks help from you to enhance on the other hand her massage business where she gets additional source of income. (The man you can see however is one of the customers she offers her services.) If she maximizes both the businesses, it would give her a better chance to earn enough money.   

If you'd consider, she would like to avail herself of a loan worth PHP 15,000 that she would use to buy more necessary materials for her massage services. Part of the loan will also be used for the beautification of her business place. This will surely help in attracting more customers. She really hopes that you'll grant her request. 

Every week, Conception faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials for her massage business and for the beautification of her business place.

loans.name: Sherlyn

texts.en:
Sherlyn is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sherlyn is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Sherlyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Sherlyn requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Sherlyn has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Sherlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 44 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Lorena works very hard to provide for them.

Lorena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries.

Lorena has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Eladia

texts.en:
Eladia is a 61-year-old widowed woman with three children. One of her children is in school.

Eladia is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and raw products for her business.

Eladia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and raw products for her business

loans.name: Nicky Ann

texts.en:
Nicky Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell to customers.

NWTF is re-listing Nicky Ann's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angela is 60 years old now.

Angela has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell .

Angela has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Angela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 54 years old and married with five children.

Delia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Delia has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ana Liza

texts.en:
Ana Liza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana Liza is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ana Liza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ana Liza requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Ana Liza has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Ana Liza would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Abdul, one of Ruma agents. Abdul lives in South Bogor, located in West Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only son. Abdul owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. His community sees him as an informative, trusted and kind mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Abdul needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Abdul’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later on, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

As seen in the photo, Abdul is the one who is holding his cute son at his own stall. He is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Zainah

texts.en:
Zainah is a 27-year-old,single lady. She lives in Irbid, she is a conservative woman and asked her brother to take her place in the photo. 

Zainah is applying for a loan to help her brother, who is studying software engineering pay for his university fees. she is a helpful and adorable lady and wants to provide for her siblings all what she can. She is working in the human resources field, and she spends her income on the household expenses to help her parents. That's why she could not cover her brother`s education fees.

loans.use: to pay for her brother`s education fees

loans.name: Elezandra

texts.en:
Elezandra is married with one child and works hard to support her family. She has a food production/vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for use in her business.

Elezandra has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Metzilyn

texts.en:
Metzilyn is 32 years old and married with three children.  With all three of her children in school, Metzilyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, where she sells a variety of items such as soap, canned goods, noodles, and personal care products. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Metzilyn has been in this business for two years. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children and all attend school . she also takes care of additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis from home . She has been in this business for 11 years. 

She has applied for a loan from MCDT - SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Wilter is 28 years old, married and blessed with 5 children. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last 6 years. 

She will be using the loan to buy another dairy cow and hopes this will enable her to get more milk for sell and make more income to support her family. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children, buy another dairy cow and repay the loan. Her future hopes are to improve her dairy farming, make more income and support her family.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow and hopes this will enable her to get more milk for sell and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of charcoal for sale to clients and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and married with three children, one child is still in school, Arlene works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other personal care products.

Arlene has been in this business for 5 years . 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other personal care products

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 35 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Rowena has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, beveages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Jerris

texts.en:
Hello lenders! This is Jerris, one of Ruma’s agents. Jerris lives in Sukabumi, a village located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 miles) from the national capital of Indonesia, Jakarta. Jerris is happily married, and together with his wife, they have two daughters. As his main source of income, Jerris owns and manages a small stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. 

By supporting this loan, you will be providing extra working capital for Jerris' shop. This will allow Jerris to become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product called "Mapan" designed for lower-income communities. Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change at agents like Jerris and as their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children. As a Mapan agent, Jerris is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Jerris will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Jerris believes that his community will be able to have access to higher quality products with better prices. 

Jerris is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide additional working capital to facilitate the introduction of Ruma's new savings plan for low-income communities.

loans.name: Haxhirete

texts.en:
Haxhirete bought 50 beehives with your previous loan and wants to add ten more. She did not have any expansion from the current ones because she placed the hives up in a mountain (to prevent them from pesticides) where the weather during winter times was very rough and unfortunately damaged some of them. From this experience she learned that the hives should be placed in the winter in her village where the temperatures are okay for the bees and take them to the mountains in the the summer time. 

"I want to expand this business and see it as the only source of income for my family," said Haxhirete to the branch assistant.

loans.use: to add some more beehives to her existing ones.

loans.name: Khaerunisa

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma agents, Khaerunisa. Khaerunisa lives in South Serang, a semi urban area located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Khaerunisa is a young woman who owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. Even though she is still young, but she has a big spirit to become an entrepreneur. Her customers sees her as a trusted and friendly mobile provider.

As the business grows, Khaerunisa needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Khaerunisa’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so her community can have access to better products with lower prices. As seen in the photo, Khaerunisa is the one who is standing. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase mobile airtime credits for helping her semi urban community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry to increase her income from selling poultry products

loans.name: Mahpudin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Mahpudin. Mahpudin lives in South Bogor, located in West Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only son. Mahpudin owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. His community sees him as an informative, funny, kind and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Mahpudin needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Mahpudin’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later on, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. As seen in the photo, Mahpudin is the one who is standing. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Guohua

texts.en:
Guohua, aged 51, is married with two children who live away from home. Her husband is a construction worker who has a lower-back injury that he received at work. In addition, Guohua takes care of her two grandsons who are both in school. 

Guohua owns a tricycle and sells a kind of national food called “guo kui” (stuffed flatbreads). Her stall is mobile but, most of the time, she is near a school, and most of her clients are students from the school. Her stall does very well and can support her family.

Guohua has requested a loan of CNY 15,000 from MicroCred Nanchong.As she bought a house for her family last year and had a loan from the bank.She will use the loan to pay off the debt.She hopes that her husband will soon get better, that she will have more customers, and that, in the future, she can provide her grandsons with a better education.

loans.use: to pay off her debt

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en:
Rezo is 51 years old and has four children and five grandchildren. The picture shows him with one of his grandsons. He is proud of them and loves having them around. The big family lives together on a farm in the village of Samgori. They earn a living by raising and selling cattle.
