They also produce cheese and yogurt from the milk, which they sell on the local market.

In his spare time, Rezo must work in a second job as a driver because the family needs the additional money.

With the help of the loan, Rezo will buy some calves to raise on his farm. When they are full-grown, he will sell them for a profit.

loans.use: to buy calves which he will raise and sell for a profit in order to support his family.

loans.name: Soma

texts.en:
40 year old Soma lives in a small village named Babupara in Falakata, Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). The daughter is married and son works in a ration shop. Soma has received education till grade 3. Unfortunately she had lost her husband few years ago, so she is the breadwinner of the family. 

The only source of income for her family is a small grocery store. Soma looks after the store. She sells things of daily necessity like biscuits, flour, oil, sugar, salt etc. but the income is hardly enough to cover her family's needs. Of late, having been hit by high inflation and an unbalanced monthly income, she could hardly think of savings for the future. With the growing costs of the essential commodities, Soma wants to increase her income and planned to expand her business.  So she applied a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more stock of inventories like sugar, edible oil, spices, cookies, etc. in a bulk. 

She hopes she will ensure her family safeguarding against losses from illnesses and other emergencies with the help of the business profit. It will help her to create a secured life for their future.
Soma thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Sumber Mulia Group

texts.en:
The Sumber Mulia Group consist of eight members, all women who have a similar business as a pig breeder. They already had six loans from MUK and they used it to support the business by purchase piglets, vitamins and medicines. Most of them had other jobs, such as a farmer or employee in a fish pond. Their homes are near the beach and their husbands work as fishermen. 

After passed several loans cycle, the group has savings, has increased the number of their pigs and they have improved their standard of living. They can renovate their houses and kitchens or buy things that they need most.

Because the price for feed is still high, the Sumber Mulia Group still needs a loan. With the increased amount of the loan, they will use it to purchase superior feed. They buy piglets or renovate the cages with their own money. 

Ketut using her portion of loan to purchase feed only. Now she has six piglets. She hopes she can sell them with a high price five months later. 

All the profit is used to support her children's education and saving.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Pesagi Indah 1 Group

texts.en:
The Pesagi Indah 1 group would like to thank lenders, Kiva, and MUK for their support. Pesagi Indah 1 group got a loan for the second time, totaling 24,500,000 IDR. There are now seven members in the group. One member resigned because she had to move to the city following her husband's getting work there.

Ni Putu, the group’s head, purchased pigs with her loan and sold them all to the big buyer. With her profits, and with the help of a new loan from MUK, she plans to purchase local piglets and feed. With her overall increase in household income, she has supported the daily needs of her family and is saving for sudden needs.

Having been successful with her pig business, Ni Putu will use this period of the loan to purchase four local pigs for pork barbecue and will maintain them for two months. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy feeds, now that she has a sow. The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but she remains optimistic about her business going forward. With all the benefits she gets, she plans to repair her home and also to save for the capitalization of her pig business.

loans.use: to purchase four local pigs and feed.

loans.name: Dúo Danny Group

texts.es:
Dúo Danny
Sigue siendo integrada por las señora Lucia sigue contando con la bendición de Dios en mantener a sus clientes quienes son parte vital para su negocio, doña Lucy como la conocen sus clientes sigue ofreciendo tortillas en 3 tiempos de comida, ella logra la preparación y venta de un quintal y medio en maíz diariamente, esto hace que sus ventas y ganancias siempre sean buenas, está convencida de que el crédito es un apoyo grande para sus negocios, el cual se convierte en ganancias y beneficio para sus hogares.Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz para seguir con su negocio en ventas de tortillas los 3 tiempos.
texts.en: The Duo Danny Group still includes Lucia, who with God's blessing has been able to maintain her customers who are vital to her business.  Lucy, as her customers call her, still sells tortillas at 3 meal times. She prepares and sells one-and-a-half quintals of corn every day [about 150 pounds], and so her sales and her income have always been good. She is sure that the loan will be a great help to her business, and will result in income and benefits to her household. She is requesting this loan to buy corn to continue with her business selling tortillas for 3 meal times a day.

loans.use: to buy corn to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Ath

texts.en:
Ath, 40, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children. To make a living, she works for a drinking water factory and earns, on average, USD 5.00 a day. Her husband, Voeurn, 50, is a private motorcycle mechanic with a daily income of USD 8.00 a day.

Recently, her husband’s business has been going badly since he does not have enough motorcycle spare parts to satisfy the customers. To secure her husband’s business, Ath would like to apply for a Kiva loan to buy some motorcycle spare parts for her spouse.

She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy some motorcycle spare parts for her husband's motorcycle repair business.

loans.name: Dúo Luchando Por Nuestros Sueños Group

texts.es: Dúo Luchando por Nuestros Sueños La encargada de este grupo es doña Glenda quien tiene zapatería en general desde hace muchos años. Su sueño es seguir creciendo cada día. La venta está muy buena y tiene varios pedidos de zapatos en diferente numeración, estilo, colores y calidad, pero necesita un préstamo para poder comprar lo que le hace falta y no fallarle a sus compradores.
texts.en: The leader of the Duo Luchando por Nuestros Suenos [Fighting for Our Dreams] Group is Glenda, who has had a small shoe store for many years. Her dream is to continue growing every day. Her sales are very good, and she has received a number of orders for different sizes, styles, colors and qualities. However, she needs a loan to be able to buy what she needs and to avoid letting her customers down.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena, a diligent and hardworking mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to purchase additional grocery items for her small grocery store. This way, she will be able to sell more goods, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her small grocery store

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny, 28, is from Dapitan, Philippines. She is a single parent who bravely raising her children. For the past six years she has a direct-selling business. Because Jenny became a new member of PMPC she wanted to be able to earn more through other business venture. She has decided to start raising hogs and is applying for a 7,000 PHP loan from PMPC to buy bags of feed and animal vitamins. She will be very happy someday if she can see her family living comfortably and bountifully.

loans.use: to buy bags of feed and animal vitamins

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 46 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Imelda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell in her food stall.

Imelda has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 42 years old and married with two children. Jennifer works very hard to provide for them.

Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices and etc.

Jennifer has been in this business for 7 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices and etc

loans.name: Mais

texts.en:
Mais is 25 years old married woman without children.
Mais cannot be a nonproductive woman as she is very ambitious and wants to depends on herself and achieve her dreams and become an example to other women.

She is living in a rented house with her husband and now she wants to try to save money and buy a small house for them, therefore she decided to use her talent in making home antiques and flower arrangements.

She is getting good income from her work that's why she wants to expand her work and cover more customer`s needs.  Therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy more supplies of clay and more materials to increase her products to sell.

loans.use: to help her buy more supplies of clay and more materials to increase her home antiques products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in shoes and sandals for men and women, so that she can increase her income.

loans.name: Royson

texts.en: Royson has dreamed of having an additional motorcycle unit that can help raise more income for his family. He applied for a loan from PMPC to buy the unit. He hopes to see his business grow and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: To purchase an additional motorcycle unit

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en: Joselyn a responsible mother requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more kilos of fruits & vegetables for retail

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 24 years old and single with one child. Catherine works very hard to provide for them.

Catherine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, breads, canned goods, cooking oil and etc.

Catherine has been in this business for 4 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, breads, canned goods, cooking oil and etc

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Eliza works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Eliza is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Eliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 35 years old and has three children. Josephine is married and has three children are still in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josephine has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Honey Cris

texts.en:
Honey Cris is 41 years old and married with one child. Honey Cris works very hard to provide for them.

Honey Cris runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care and other groceries.

Honey Cris has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other 
groceries. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Honey Cris would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Japit May

texts.en:
Japit May operates a tricycle (motorcycle with side car), transportation services. She is 38 year old  married woman with 2 year old child from Talibon, Bohol. She has been operating a tricycle transportation services for 3 years.  

She has requested a loan to buy tires and tricycle hubs. With these, her livelihood will improve and able to travel safely. It could provide ease and comfort to the passengers who will take a ride. Thus, it enables to augment her income and able to provide the need of her child. She could now start to pay her obligations and handle her finances. 

 Japit May would like manage her current livelihood successfully and at the same time  she is eager to manage her own business someday for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy tires and tricycle hubs

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is responsible and dedicated in her work as health worker in their barangay. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life. This work has enabled her to survive. Rosita became an active member of PMPC and applied for a loan in order to gain funding for her chosen business. She is now starting her pig raising business. She applied a loan to PMPC for the purchase of pig feeds and vitamins. This will allow her generate more income and be able to improve and expand it in the future.

loans.use: purchase pig feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio is a married 62-year-old businessman from Ozamiz who has expertise in selling. He runs a little sari-sari (variety) store and earns a modest income that sufficiently supports his family..He maintains his cooperative membership in good standing without any record of default. Now, he has applied for a loan to restock his store with basic commodities and other items. Antonio continues to look for better business opportunities, bringing passion and energy to his desire to support his family.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities and other items

loans.name: Apple Fe

texts.en: Apple Fe is 30 years old, married, has five children and lives in Ozamiz City. Apple Fe has a snack-vending business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase soft drinks, bread and candies. Apple Fe has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, bread and candies

loans.name: Richie

texts.en: Richie is married and lives in Dapitan. Her husband earns a living in his farming activities. At the age of 35, she is focused and determined in pursuing her goals for the sake of the family. She is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. From her desire to earn additional income, she wants to start a sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She has applied for a loan to buy her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Someday, Richie hopes that her business would grow and benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
ADRIANO TIENE 51 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA , DESDE HACE MAS DE 20 AÑOS APROXIMADAMENTE. VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD PEQUEÑA, TRANQUILA, DONDE LA GENTE SE DEDICA A LA GANADERIA Y AGRICULTURA MAYORMENTE, EN UN CASERÍO LLAMADO SAN NICOLAS, EN EL DISTRITO DE ZAÑA QUE PERTENECE A LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGIÓN LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DEL PERÚ.

ADRIANO SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA Y COMPRA EVENTA DE ANIMALES MENORES, EN LAS FERIA DE LOS DIAS MARTES EN MERCADO PARADA NUEVA CAYALTI Y EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO.DESDE HACE MAS DE 5 AÑOS APROXIMADAMENTE. TRABAJANDO TAMBIÉN COMO PEÓN AGRÍCOLA EN EMPRESA CAYALTI. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO SERÁ LA COMPRA DE ANIMALES MENORES, ALIMENTACION Y OTROS GASTOS DIVERSOS, ESTO LE PERMITIRÁ TENER MAYORES INGRESOS Y MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en: Adriano is 51 years old, and lives in his own home. He has lived for more than 20 years in San Nicolas, a small, quiet community where people work primarily in livestock and agriculture. This hamlet is in the Zana district, which is in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. Adriano has worked for more than 5 years raising small animals and selling them at the market on Tuesdays in Nueva Cayalti and from his home. He also works as an agricultural laborer for a business in Cayalti. The loan will be used to buy small animals and feed and for other costs, which will allow him to earn more income and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy small animals and feed and for other costs.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 37 years old and single.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maricel has been raising pigs for 11 years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Relinda

texts.en:
Relinda is 40 years old, married and has five children, all in school.

Relinda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Relinda requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Relinda has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Relinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Theary

texts.en: Theary, 26, is originally from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She has two children. To make a living, she has worked for five years in a garment factory and earns, on average, (USD) $5 per day. Her husband, Thou, 28, is a construction project contractor. During this time, her husband’s job is running badly since he is lacking construction materials to compete with others. Therefore, Theary is applying for a Kiva loan to buy construction materials such as bricks, stones, timber, cement, plumbing supplies and so on. She hopes this loan will help her husband’s job to go smoothly as well as bring in regular income for her family. She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a native of Talibon, Bohol. She raises and sells hogs to earn a living. She is 32 years of age, with three dependents, ages 3, 7 and 9 years old, respectively.  

To augment her income, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various goods ranging from canned goods, sugar, noodles and soap to beverages, soft drinks and many others. Her husband has an income also that helps defray the family's daily expenses. 

She is asking for a loan to buy pigs, feeds and various stock for the store, like flour, brown sugar and assorted groceries. It would boost Grace's way of raising pigs and enable her to maintain the merchandise of her store. She will be able to improve her earnings and start to manage her finances.

Grace would like to improve both of her sources of income to support the welfare of her growing children and support their respective studies, as well.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feeds and various stock for the variety store

loans.name: Ma. Nena

texts.en: Ma. Nena, a farmer, is looking ahead to the next season. She wants to prepare the land and seed beds well. She has applied for a 14,000 PHP loan from Kiva's field partner PMPC for fertilizer for her cornfield. She hopes to save enough money to buy another hectare of land to cultivate for her family, most especially her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cornfield.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a farm where she keeps poultry and also grows maize. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale farm. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for personal use.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area favourable for the business and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fabric. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use.

loans.name: Denita

texts.en:
Denita is 52 years old and married with five children, two in school. Denita works very hard to provide for her family.

Denita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, beverages, and other groceries.

Denita has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Denita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, beverages, and other groceries

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 51 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Juanita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell.

Juanita has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo and noodles. 

In the future, Juanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 56 years old and has two children.

Elsa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elsa has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 23 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Grace has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Grace has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 53 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Cirila has a buying and selling of bananas business in the Philippines. Cirila requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more bananas to sell to customers.

Cirila has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Cirila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to customers.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 51 years old and married with four children. Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack food, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Elsa has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as soap, soft drinks, beverages, shampoo, sugar, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Elsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack food, beverages, home care products  and other groceries

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 58 years old and has five children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Evangeline has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, 45, is residing in Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She has only one child. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business in a small farmland, primarily growing rice and selling her agricultural products to local dealers and customers at the market. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 30 years. 

On average, she is able to make earnings of USD $5.00 a day. 

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of traveling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 59 years old, married with six children.

Melba works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, and coffee.

Melba has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buy and sell charcoal.

Melba aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, and coffee.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely works hard to support her family. Mely is married with four children and has a water-refilling station business in the Philippines.

Mely requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Mely has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her water business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, 55, is married and has one child. For the past five years she has poured her energy into her business preparing and selling food.

Mary Jane has applied for a 11,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy ingredients such as spices, meat, fish, chicken, cooking oil, additional utensils and other materials to make her food. She is saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the food she makes and sells.

loans.name: Jenifer's Group

texts.en:
Jenifer (First from the left) is an empowered womam, aged 38, married with five children. She lives with her husband in Kanamba village. She is a farmer and mainly grows coffee, banana, millet and cocoa. She sales agricultural products to earn a living and supports her family.

After attending several YICE trainings on farming as business, Jenifer and the group members acquired knowledge and skills in farm management which can enable them improve the quality and quantity of their produce. They therefore ask for a small loan so as to acquire capital to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers, herbicides, and high quality seedlings. With this loan, they will be able to effectively translate the knowledge learned into practice on their farms and be able to improve on the quality and quantity of their produce.

Jenifer’s dream is to create job opportunities in her area of residence through improving farming activities in the community. She plans to use her income to develop a demonstration plot for other people to learn good farming.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers, herbicides, and high quality seedlings.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 41 years old and married with four children.

Mildred works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, bread, etc.

Mildred has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fruit.

Mildred aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, and bread

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
Joanne is 32 years old and married with four children. With all of her children in school, Joanne works very hard to provide for them.

Joanne runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, eggs, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Joanne has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, biscuits, junk foods, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Joanne would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, eggs, beverages, home care products and other  groceries

loans.name: Pesagi Indah 2 Group

texts.en:
Ni Wayan repaid her first loan on time. During six months of raising pigs, Ni Wayan enjoyed satisfactory results.
From the sales, Ni Wayan is able to pay for her family's needs. The group of six members hopes to borrow a second loan of the same amount. They say thanks to you lenders and to Kiva and MUK for supporting their business.

Having succeeded in the previous loan period, the Pesagi Indah 2 group is proceeding to the next loan. Based on the assessment of MUK, the group received 21.000.000 IDR for group lending and individuals got 3.500.000 IDR. Because most of the member have been able to increase the number of pig populations, the current loan will be used to buy feed and fix the cages. Ni Wayan will use the loan to buy feed, because her sow birthed 10 piglets, and to build new cages. She hopes to become a major pig seller in her village with all the profits improving the welfare of her family and making her dream come true to see her children succeed in their education.
One member is not in the picture because of illness.

loans.use: to buy feed and build a new cage

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou signed up for a membership with Kiva's field partner PMPC and borrowed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari, or general store in the Philippines. She has been successful in her endeavor and is making good sales presently.

Wanting to build on her success, Marilou would like to take out another loan, this one for 7,000 PHP. She will use it to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil and noodles, among other things.

Marilou is thankful for the capital PMPC extends to a small-time borrower like herself. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil and noodles, etc. for her shop.

loans.name: Flor De Campo Group 2

texts.en:
Margarita cannot read or write. She regrets not having studied, but she says, surely her parents did not had the capacity to support her to study. Her father sold thread, had no established store, and sold at the town market. Her father and mother carried their goods to and from their home to the village market every day. He also sold products in other villages.
She married at age sixteen. Her husband did street selling in other villages. In 2008 she learned about Association of Women United for Life, and with her first credit her husband and she began a store of staple goods. This year she is receiving her sixth credit, which she will use to expand her store. She says her store still is a small business.
Margarita says that the business allows her to offer her children a better feeding and the opportunity to study.
Margarita is the leader of Group Flor de Campo 2 (Flower of the Field Group 2). The group is integrated by 7 women, their average age is 36 years, on average they have 4 children, and they are from the Ethnicity Ixil Maya. They will invest their loans in expanding their staple goods stores; Their loans are in average of Q 3,829.

loans.use: To expand her store of staple goods

loans.name: Flor De Campo Group 1

texts.en:
Juana was four years old when her father died because of the war in between the Guatemala’s Army and the Guerrilla. With great limitations her mother took care of them, Juana and her sister could not study because of these limitations.
She was born in one of Chajul villages, when she was 8 years old she began picking coffee with her mother and sister, her mother told them that only in this way they could grow and get ahead. She worked until she was 10 years old, when her mother left with another man, she lived with her grandmother until she was 14, when she got married. When she was with her grandmother she had no clothes and could only wear used clothes that some neighbors gave her.
When she got married, they began living with her grandmother until her husband and she decided they have to go away. They worked hard and had some savings, then they began a small store selling household essentials. She has four children alive and four more died.
This year she got her second credit, both of them have been used to expand the store. Her loans with the Chajulense Association of Women United for Life have allowed her store to grow, and give a better life for her family.
Juana is the leader of Flor del Campo Group 1 (Flower of the Field Group 1), the group is composed of 7 women between 28 and 38 years of age, they are from the Ethnicity Ixil Maya. As an average they have 4 children. They invest their loans in retail activities, their average loan amount is Q 3,200.

loans.use: To expand her household essentials store

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Carolina is 37 years old and all of her children are sent to school.

Carolina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Carolina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Carolina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell .

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
For more than 10 years, Evangeline operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells a variety of merchandise like coffee, powdered soap, noodles, soft drinks, edible oil and many other things. She is a 44-year-old married woman with six children. Her oldest child is 22 and the youngest is two years old. Her husband's occupation is a farmer.

She has requested a loan to buy stocks like school supplies, canned goods, soft drinks and toiletries. With the aid of these resources, Evangeline's income will slowly improve.

Evangeline is determined to handle her sari-sari (variety) store business to be productive and also to be financially stable to continue financing the education of all her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks like school supplies, canned goods, soft drinks and toiletries.

loans.name: Peou

texts.en: Peou is a 29-year-old married cloth weaver who lives in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has been doing this since 2013. Her husband is 30 years old and earns some income from rice cultivation. Both Peou and her husband can make a daily income of $8. She wants to buy piglets to fatten and sell but she does not have enough money, so she is now requesting a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI. With the loan, she will have enough finances to buy piglets to fatten and earn additional income to improve her living standards. In the future, she is going to buy more farmland and to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 65 years old and widowed with four children. One child is still in school. Ofelia works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, juice, sugar, shampoo, soap and other personal care products.

Ofelia has been in this business for nine years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, juice, sugar, shampoo, soap and other personal care products

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Emelia has been in this business for five years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 39 years old and is married with two children. With two children in school, Merlie works very hard to provide for them.

Merlie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like beverages, condiments and other groceries.

Merlie has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, soaps, juices, shampoos, beverages and other groceries. 

In the future, Merlie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like beverages, condiments and other groceries.

loans.name: Flor De Campo Group 3

texts.en:
Rosa has 5 sisters and 3 brothers. Her parents and all of her siblings made great sacrifices so that all studied. All of them worked to send their big brother to Guatemala City so he could study Basic Studies. In Junior High School, he studied and worked, so he began sending money for her second sister to let her study.
When Rosa concluded her Primary Education, she could not study for three years, because her family did not have the resources to provide her Secondary Education. At that time she learned to weave, her income was to her family. In a neighboring village, she found an Educational Project that gave her no cost Secondary Education. She moved to that village and lived with her grandmother.

All of her siblings decided that she should continue studying until she graduated, she graduated as a Teacher of Primary Education.

Her boyfriend went to work to the United States for five years, and she married her boyfriend of seven years, at the age of 23 years.

When her father in law died, her husband inherited a store and three children (three small brothers of her husband). This year she received her second loan from the Chajulense Association of Women United for Life. With her husband they have the goal to expand their business so that it becomes a distribution company.
Rosa is the leader of Flor del Campo Group 3, the group is integrated by 7 women, the average age of the group is 28. On average they have 2 children, and they are from the Ethnicity Ixil Maya. Their loans are on average Q 3,029, and they will invest their loans in a staple goods store.

loans.use: To expand her staple goods store into a distribution company.

loans.name: Sabma Group

texts.en: Keo understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Keoknows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Keo purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Keo is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To set up a food cart

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
In 2007, the borrower, 57, started a small business in a local market. Her daughter was affected with multi-drug resistant TB and had to undergo surgery and treatment for almost two years. During that time, the borrower took her of her daughter while also tending to her business. Fortunately, her daughter has recovered and is now studying. 

The borrower has a small shop where she sells clothes for infants, toys, coloring books and puzzles, among other objects. Her business is directed at children, who are her main customers. She would like to expand this business, through the purchase of varied goods, such as wool for sweaters and other clothing. This would increase her average monthly income, improving her livelihood.  In the future, she would like to move to a larger space in another market, with access to more customers.

loans.use: To purchase wool and other fabrics for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her at-home convenience store

loans.name: Suzzette

texts.en:
Suzzette is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 47 years old with two children still in school.

She has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of used clothes to sell in her stall.

Suzzette has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxas of used clothes to sell in her stall

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 51 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lourdes has been in this business for 40 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Janette

texts.en:
Ma. Janette is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Janette is 24 years old and one of her children is in school.

Ma. Janette has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Ma. Janette requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her business.

Ma. Janette has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ma. Janette would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Lorna is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities for the past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To set up a small cafeteria

loans.name: Lin

texts.en:
Lin, 32, is a married woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has only one child. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and sells the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for around ten years. She is able to make an income of USD 2.00 per day, on average.  

Recently she wants to operate one more farming business by growing cassava. Therefore, she would like to apply for Kiva loan to buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for her cassava farming. With the supporting from this loan, she hopes that she can get more income and improve her living standard. She would like to thank to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is from Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Philippines. She is 56 years old, married and has five children. In order to sustain their family, Imelda sells bleaching liquid in front of their house. Her product is salable since most of the women in the area are using bleaching liquid in their house especially in their laundry. She has had this business for 5 years and it's doing well, she earns a meager income to support her family in addition to the income of her husband. 

She requested a loan to purchase more gallons of bleaching liquid to increase sales and serve more customers. Imelda has been a member of PMPC for 3 years, she is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of bleaching liquid to increase sales and serve more customers

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 60 years old and widowed with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lucia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Lucia has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ma. Helyn

texts.en:
Ma. Helyn is 40 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Ma. Helyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Helyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like dried fish, junk food, home product care and other groceries.

Ma. Helyn has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Ma. Helyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like dried fish, junk food, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Luisita

texts.en:
Luisita is 35 years old and married with two children. Luisita works very hard to provide for them.

Luisita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap and other personal care products.

Luisita has been in this business for 4 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap and other personal care products

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dress making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, needles, threads, etc. for her dress making business.

Natividad has been in this business for two years. Natividad earns more income from her general store.

Natividad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, needles, threads, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Genela

texts.en:
Genela is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store and pig fattening business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.  

Genela dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lydia is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lydia has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Lydia requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca  fiber and other supplies.

Lydia has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goods for her grocery store and ice creams to increase her income.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 48 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is in the photograph with his wife, File. With the loan that they are requesting from you they want to pay for some surgery that their 27-year-old married daughter has been scheduled and with the rest of the loan to build a fence around their yard. 

Martin and File are in their early 50s and have been involved with livestock for a living; they’ve got three dairy cows and they sell about 20-25 liters of raw milk to a dairy farm. They also sell three calves a year for a total amount of $1500. In addition they have one sow and sell about 15-20 piglets a year and also plant wheat for their own use and fodder that is only for their animals.

loans.use: to pay for the surgery of his 27-year-old daughter and with the little rest of the money build a fence around the yard

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower, 20, has a four year old daughter. For the last two years, she has been selling children’s clothes at her mother in law’s stall in a local market. Two months ago, her partner started treatment for TB. He is no longer working and the borrower is the sole source of income for the family.  Partners In Health – Peru has been supporting the family with food coupons for the past two months and will continue to support them until the family’s condition is stabilized. 

However, the borrower would like to provide for her family, expanding her business. She would like to have her own stall to sell children clothing.

loans.use: To expand children clothing sales

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower, 36, is a migrant from the North of Peru. She has been living in the capital for the past 18 years and has three children, 14, 9 and 4 years old. She has been selling ice cream and beverages outside schools for a number of years. In 2013, her husband fell ill. Eventually, he was diagnosed with TB and had to undergo treatment. He has successfully completed treatment but is still weak and unable to work. 

Last year, with support from their church, the borrower set up a small convenience store at home. The borrower is in charge of the store while she is at home, but she still goes out to the street to sell ice cream, leaving her 14 year old daughter helping out at the store. In order to be able to stay home, she would like to expand her business, selling more products and improving the security conditions of her business.

loans.use: To expand convenience store

loans.name: Selvin

texts.en:
Selvin lives in a community in the Department of Yoro Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (Beans and coffee). Age 29 years; He is married and has two children. It is clear that Selvin works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying improve the living conditions.
Selvin is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Ramziya

texts.en:
Ramziya is a 45-year-old married Palestinian refugee who started selling clothes in January 2013. She assists her husband, who works  as a blacksmith, with their income to improve their family’s living situation. 
Her business and home are located in a Palestinian camp where the access to external customers is difficult and limited which is a big challenge she has to overcome.
For this reason, Ramziya is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to start an additional income business that has to do with selling pickles to increase her income and improve her living in parallel to her current clothes selling business.
Ramziya is working hard to develop her family's living in a  well managed way.

loans.use: To start an additional income business that has to do with selling pickles to increase her income and improve her living

loans.name: Dahly

texts.en: Dahly is aged 39 and is married to a OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). They're blessed with three children. She owns and manages a retail store in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. She also sells noodles for snacks in their village for additional income. Due to inadequate capital on her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase sugar, coffee, cooking oil, candies, chips, canned goods, biscuits and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her retail store will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, coffee, cooking oil, candies, chips, canned goods, biscuits and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Cinthia Natali

texts.es:
Cinthia Natali tiene 29 años de edad, soltero , dos hijos a su cargo , vive en casa familiar; en una zona rural, en el distrito de Oyotún, que está ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, Costa Norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería; hace 3 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; compra de una mochila para fumigar; esto le servirá para poder brindar mejores servicios,por lo mismo aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cinthia Natali is 29 years old, single and with two children in her care. She lives in the home of a family member in a rural area in the district of Oyotún. This is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.

She has worked providing services as a day laborer for 3 years in a business located in her home. She is requesting this loan to invest in a fixed asset -  to buy a backpack for fumigation. This will help her to provide better services. It will also increase her income and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a backpack for fumigating.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa engages in buying and selling ripe mangoes. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. She is 39 years old with three dependents. Her oldest is 18 and the youngest is 11. In addition to that, she also engages in fish vending. She sells fish to earn a living. Her husband is a fisherman. She is the one selling her husband's daily catch.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing net and additional capital for her buy-and-sell business. This is very essential in augmenting both of her businesses. With this, she could be able to purchase additional stock of mangoes and improve the catch of her husband as well, thus making her finances become stable. With this, she could start to expand and be able to venture into any business opportunities to be productive.

She hopes that she will properly handle her existing business to be successful in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and get additional capital for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.en:
Pascual is a married man with two children. He is a very hard working entrepreneur. Pascual is 67 years old now.

Pascual has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Pascual requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

Pascual has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Pascual would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Jessa dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricris is 34 years old and has five children who are in school.

Maricris has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Maricris requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

Maricris has been in this business for two years. In the future, Maricris would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica works hard to support her family. Veronica is married and has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines.

Veronica requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Veronica has been in this business for 20 years now.

Veronica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 43 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming vegetables for six years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Alvaro José

texts.es: Alvaro tiene actualmente 23 años, pero su experiencia en la confección data desde su niñez cuando ayudaba a su papá en el negocio familiar que consiste en la confección y comercialización de uniformes; hace tres años a Álvaro le correspondió hacerse cargo del negocio que atiende diariamente de 8:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. Esta circunstancia lo motivó a combatir los miedos e ir más allá de sus tareas cotidianas para demostrar que tiene potencial para el crecimiento innovador. Dentro de sus proyectos personales se encuentra la de capacitarse para tener los conocimientos que le faciliten el logro de la visión que tiene para el negocio que consiste en ampliarlo y tener una buena infraestructura; por lo pronto requiere adquirir unas máquinas planas que le permitan obtener el acabado exigido por su clientela, calidad que le permitirá explorar nuevos mercados e incrementar sus ventas. Esta inversión la financiará con su primer CrediKiva al cual está aplicando a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
texts.en:
Alvaro is currently 23 years old but his experience in sewing dates back to his childhood when he used to help his father in the family business making and selling uniforms. Three years ago it fell to Alvaro to take charge of the business where he works from 8am to 6pm every day. These circumstances motivated him to face his fears and to go beyond his daily tasks in order to demonstrate that he has potential for innovative growth.

One of his personal projects is to train himself to give himself the knowledge he needs to achieve his vision for the business, which is to expand it and have a good infrastructure. For the time being he needs to buy some flat sewing machines which will enable him to achieve the quality of finish demanded by his clientele. This will enable him to explore new markets and increase his sales.

He will finance this investment with his first Kiva loan which he is applying for through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

loans.use: to buy flat sewing machines which enable him to achieve the finish demanded by his clientele.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie works hard to support her family. Virgie is widowed and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Virgie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her tailoring business.

Virgie has been in this business for 40 years now.

In the future, Virgie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 54 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Judy is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to pay for labourers' salaries for cleaning the corn field.

Judy has been farming corn for eight years and also earns additional income from direct selling of Avon products.

Judy is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for labourers' salaries for cleaning the corn field

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 37 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Virginia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

Virginia has been in this business for five years. Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Saolin's Group

texts.en: Saolin is a rice farmer who has two hectares of farmland. She is also a paid worker, working on another farm to get a fee. She lives in Kampong Thom province. She is 41 years old and a married mother of a child who is still depending on her. Through her businesses, she could earn about 20,000 KHR per day and have around 9,000 KHR daily for emergency needs. Saolin has been with VisionFund for three cycles already and fully repaid back the loans. The previous loans help her to have a better house to stay.  Now she is leading a small group to apply for a new loan via VisionFund to buy more farmland to expand her farming area. She hopes to earn more income to improve her family living and give her the ability to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.name: Angelitas 2 Group

texts.en:
Carmelina is one of 5 siblings, she considers that she did not have too much economic limitations with her parents, but neither of her siblings studied, she studied up to sixth grade. Her 2 brothers, are peasants, her 2 sisters are housewives.
She married when she was 16, had her first and only baby when she was 17. Now she is 24 years old. Her husband works as peasant.
Carmelina began a store that sells commodities. Now she is getting her fourth credit from Chajulense Association of Women United for Life and will use her credit for expanding her store. She knows that her small business let her family get clothes, shoes and a better nutrition.
Carmelina is the leader of Angelitas Group 2 (Little Angels), the group is integrated by 6 women, and average age is 32 years, and they have in average 3 children. The average amount of the group loan is Q 4,207.79, two of the women will invest their credits in agricultural activities and four will invest in retail activities.

loans.use: To expand her commodities store

loans.name: Micah

texts.en: Micah is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sarki Gwanki Village. Micah joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Micah suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Micah will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Micah now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
BINTOU  est la cliente qui a les mains sur l’arachide.
Elle est âgée de 59 ans, BINTOU est une commerçante malienne, mariée mère de sept (07) enfants donc trois (03) écoliers. Elle n’a pas été instruite. BINTOU s’approvisionne au niveau des villages environnants. Avec son prêt elle paie les arachides pour les stocker. BINTOU  décortique ses arachides  pour revendre les graines petit à petit au marché de Diéli. Elle peut avoir des bénéfices variant entre 100 000 à 150 000FCFA par cycle.
BINTOU fait le commerce depuis plus de vingt (20) ans ; mais grâce au soutien des prêts du RMCR  son activité a beaucoup prospéré. Elle n’a pas de difficulté pour le déroulement de ses activités. Mais BINTOU sollicité un prêt un peu élevé pour améliorer son commerce.
texts.en:
Bintou is the client with her hands on the groundnuts. She is a 59-year-old Malian merchant, and a married mother of seven children, of whom three are students. She herself did not receive an education.

Bintou resupplies in the surrounding villages. She will use her loan to buy groundnuts and store them. She shells the groundnuts to gradually sell the seeds at the Dieli market. She can generate profits ranging from 100,000 to 150,000 CFA francs per loan cycle.

Bintou has been trading for over twenty years; but her activity has greatly prospered with the support of loans from RMCR. She has no difficulties in conducting her activities, but is requesting a somewhat higher loan to improve her business.

loans.use: buy bags of cereals for later resale

loans.name: Marycor

texts.en:
Marycor is from Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is 27 years old. She is married and has two children. For the past five years, she has worked in sales. In 2013, she applied for her membership in Paglaum-Multi Purpose Cooperative in order to seek financial services and insurances. Since then, she has been a good member and repays her obligations in a timely manner. 

Recently, she has asked for financial assistance in the amount of 10,000 PHP to finance farming activities such as plowing and buying of farm inputs. She has found assistance for her family's financial needs through PMPC and is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to finance farming activities such as plowing and buying of farm inputs

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en: Mary-Ann is engaged in a direct selling business. She particularly offers cosmetic products and perfume. Mary-Ann's husband operates their tricycle for passenger transportation. The couple's generated income is used for their family's basic needs. At present, Mary-Ann sells minimal items because of financial constraints. With regards to this matter, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy make-up, lipstick, and perfume to sell. She hopes to sell more items, encourage more customers to be served, and gain a bigger income as well.

loans.use: to buy make-up, lipstick, and perfume to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a widow, residing at Upper Dicayas, Dipolog. She has six children, Estela joined PMPC on March of 2013 in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. 

Recently, she's accessing her 4th loan in the amount of PHP 4,000 for additional working capital of her existing business to buy gallons of purified drinking water for resale in the local community.

loans.use: to buy gallons of purified drinking water for resale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a widowed woman, 59 years old with four children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur.

Lydia has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lydia requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lydia has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 35 years old and has three children in school.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy garments and other materials needed.

Lorelie has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy garments and other materials needed

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 34 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children attend school.

Rosenda is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosenda has been farming vegetables for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosenda would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 30 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mercedita has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Merineza

texts.en:
Merineza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a nipa roofing making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa leaves, bamboo, etc for her nipa roofing making business.

Merineza has been in this business for 10 years. Merineza earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Merineza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa leaves, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 49 years old and is married with five children.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, coffee, cereals, noodles, etc. to sell.

Yolanda has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Yolanda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, coffee, cereals, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Jorlyn

texts.en:
Ma. Jorlyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Jorlyn is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Jorlyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Jorlyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, rice, noodles and personal care products.

Ma. Jorlyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ma. Jorlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, rice, noodles and personal care products.

loans.name: Shyriel

texts.en:
Shyriel is 32 years old and married.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Shyriel is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Shyriel has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica, de 36 años de edad, es agricultora, estudio hasta segundo grado, no continuo sus estudios debido a la pobreza en que vivían sus padres; está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos de 12, 9 y 5 años de edad, de los cuales solo 2 estudian, ya que hay uno que padece una emfermedad que no camina, su pareja se dedica a cortar azúcar y a la agricultura desde hace varios años.

Verónica, se dedicaba a trabajar en algodoneras, pero ahora en día se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente a la siembra de hortalizas desde hace 12 años, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres, quienes siempre se han dedicado a este negocio; para llegar a su trabajo camina 1 kilometro y su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. todos los días.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar insumos agrícolas como comprar, veneno, semilla, abono, para sembrar 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 para sembrar hortalizas.

Verónica, sueña en ahorrar mucho para hacer una crianza de cerdos y una granja de gallinas ponedoras, para poder obtener más ingresos y así ahorrar mucho para construir una vivienda de ladrillo, ya que en la que está viviendo es de adobe y está en malas condiciones.
texts.en:
Verónica is 36 years old and a farmer. She attended school until the second grade but did not continue due to the poverty her parents were living in. She is married and has 3 children who are 12, 9 and 5 years old. Only two of them are in school because one suffers from an illness and can not walk. Her husband has made a living in agriculture and chopping sugar for many years. Verónica used to work in cotton but now she works in agriculture, specifically planting vegetables for 12 years now. She learned this skill from her parents, who have always made a living in agriculture. To get to her work, she walks 1 kilometer and her schedule is from 6:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. every day. 

The loan that she is asking for is to buy agricultural supplies such as pesticide, seeds, and fertilizer to plant 10,500 square meters of corn and 3,500 square meters of vegetables. Verónica dreams of saving up a lot of money to start breeding pigs and to have a farm of hens, in order to get more income and save up to build a brick home since the one she lives in is made of mud and is in a bad condition.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as pesticide, seeds, and fertilizer to plant 10,500 square meters of corn and 3,500 square meters of vegetables.
