loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is 44 years old and has three children. Viola is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Viola is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Viola requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Viola has been raising pigs for 11 years now and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Viola would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 48 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jenelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Jenelyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

In the future Jenelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 49 years old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 9 children. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which her son is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. 

Therefore Nasreen has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Nasreen is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her son's rickshaw so that he resume making an income

loans.name: Sabra

texts.en:
Sabra is a 45 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan wiith her one son and two daughters. Her son has been running his own business of selling clothing for 10 years. Her son is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Her son needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her son is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Sabra is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her son to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her son can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 
Sabra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her son to increase his clothing business.

loans.name: Thouk's Group

texts.en:
Thouk is ages 39 years old and a married mother of three children and only one of them is in school, living in Prey Veng province. She is rice farmer and a construction worker for twenty-one years and it earns her about 52,800KHR per day. 

Thouk has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and completely repaid back the loan. The previous loan helps her family to have a better living condition and now she is leading a small group to take a new Kiva loan again. As a group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more money to improve her family’s standard of living and ability to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees for her rice farm

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng is a father of three children and only one of them is a dependent child, living in Ponhea Krek district of the Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, he grows cassava on four hectares of farmland and selling grocery items as the main sources of his family’s income. He has been involved in this business for thirty-seven years and it earns him about 92,200KHR per day. 

This is the third loan cycle for his group which contain of two members with VisionFund. As a group leader, he will use his loan portion to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for labor fee to support his farming. He hopes that this loan will help him to gain more yields than previous year.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for labor fees to support his farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 54 years old and has five children. Beatriz is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Beatriz is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Beatriz requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Beatriz has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Beatriz would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 49 years old, with three children and works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, home care products,  and other groceries.

Letecia has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Letecia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, home care products,  and other groceries

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 39 years old and has three children. She is single and has two children are still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Susan has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 49 years old and married with five children.

Rita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rita aspires to save enough money so she continues to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
Clarissa is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Clarissa is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Clarissa has a buy and sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. Clarissa requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall.

Clarissa has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Clarissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 36 years old and with one child in school, Rosemarie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a direct selling avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like lotion, perfume, powder, etc. to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like lotion, perfume, powder, etc. to sell

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 49 years old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her two sons and two daughters. Her son has been running her own business of clothes selling for 8 years, He is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. 

Her son needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her son is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Tahira is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her son to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her son can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Tahira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: increase her son's clothing business

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
A 57-year-old mother of five children and only one of them is dependent child, Nan is living in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, she grows cassava and cashew for sale as the main sources of her family’s income for thirty-nine years. 

This is the first loan cycle for her group which contain of two members with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.  As a group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy cassava seeds, fertilizer and pay for labor fee to work on her farm. She hopes to earn more money and ability to buy more farmland to create a new business, growing rubber plant tree.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds, fertilizer and pay for labor fees to work on her farm

loans.name: Naisy's Group

texts.en: A married woman living in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Naisy is 32 years old. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice on one hectare of farmland, cassava on two hectares and rubber plant on one hectare as the main sources of her family’s income. Additionally, she also works on another farm in her village to generate more income. Naisy has been involved in these businesses for 14 years and her daily income is about 65,300 KHR. This is the first loan cycle for her group which consists of two members. She is taking her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and pay for a plowing fee. She hopes that this loan will help her to gain more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pay for a plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Yory

texts.en: Yory, 34, lives in a community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily cassava, and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market. So far, she has been in this business for 15 years. On average, she is able to earn USD 2.50 a day. In this farming season, she lacks money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Hut's Group

texts.en:
Hut, 40, is a mother of four children who keep three children in school, living in Siam Reap province. The sources of her family’s income are from doing rice farming and husking rice for twenty years. Her daily income is about 26,900KHR per day to support her family’s living. 

She has been with VisionFund for fourth cycle already and completely repaid back the loan. The previous loan helps her to get better house to stay. Now, she is applying for this new Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizers to support her farming. She expects to get more income and ability to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to support her rice farming and to send her children to school

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Loreta is 52 years old and has one child who is in school.

Loreta has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Loreta has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kimheang's Group

texts.en: Kimheang is a 31-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is in school. Kimheang is a cassava farmer for thirteen years and is living in Kampong Cham province. In order to earn additional income to support her family’s living she sells grocery items and works on another farm to get a fee.  Through these businesses, she could earn about 47,200 KHR per day. Kimheang has been with VisionFund for two cycles already and completely repaid back the loans. The previous loans helped her to have a better living condition. Now she lacks the funds to do farming so she decided to take this new Kiva loan to buy seeds and pay for labor and plowing fees. She hopes to gain more yields than last year and be able to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor and plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar, age 58, is a mother of four children. Her son owns a jewelry shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. Her son needs to purchase new varieties of jewelry material to resell. However, due to lack of money her son finds it difficult. This loan will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. For that his mother, Kousar, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her son.
He will purchase jewelry items and new varieties of jewelry. Kousar is feeling happy that she will be able to help her son with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her son to increase his jewelry business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old single Palestinian refugee who has been selling water since 2005. He puts great effort into improving his living standard. 

Ahmad used to sell vegetables, but he decided to fulfill his villagers' needs and provide them with clean drinking water. So he turned to selling water because it is a daily necessity.

Ahmad is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to help his brother pay for his travel expenses, since they are Palestinians and they have to work abroad to improve their living, Ahmad decided to support his brother in his career path, and he says that this loan will be the first step forward toward his brother's brighter future in a better place.

His business is going on just fine and he is thankful for his acquired income. He hopes that he can stay capable of increasing and developing his business in the future.

His previously acquired Al Majmoua Kiva Youth Loan helped him a lot in increasing the number of water bottles available before the holy Ramadan month when people consume water more than normally, and this increased his income.

loans.use: To help his brother pay for his travel expenses to seek work abroad.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
47-year-old Dulce is engaged in a hog raising business. She is a married  woman with five dependents. She raises and sells pigs to earn a living. She has been engaged in that kind of business for more than 10 years now.  She has not enough funds to finance her existing livelihood.

She  is asking for a loan to buy piglets and to use as additional capital for a sari-sari (variety) store start-up. Dulce's sources of income will start to improve. She would now be able to open a sari-sari (variety) store, and she is doing her best to handle it properly.  Slowly, Dulce would now be able to pay her obligations and start to expand her business. 

She is hoping that she will be successful in managing both sources of income for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy piglets and have additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store start-up

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 39 years old and five of her children are in school.

Jocelyn has a rice vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 32 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell of nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Analiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Wend La Tongre De Bingo Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZENABO est responsable du groupe WEND LA TONGRE DE BINGO. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 01an. 01 va à l’école.
Mme vend des légumes et des céréales depuis plus de 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son village.
Elle veut s’acheter 03 sacs d’arachide, 03sacs de sorgho blanc et 04sacs de petit mil.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande commerçante.
texts.en: Mrs ZENABO is the head of the WEND LA TONGRE DE BINGO group. Married, she is the mother of 3 children. The eldest is 7 years old and the youngest is 1 year old. One of her children attends school. Mrs ZENABO has been selling vegetables and cereals for over three years. She gets her supplies at her village market. She wants to purchase 3 bags of groundnuts, 3 bags of white sorghum and 4 bags of pearl millet. With her profits, she wants to build her activity. She hopes to become a great trader.

loans.use: to purchase bags of groundnuts, white sorghum and pearl millet.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana works hard to support her family. She is married with one child and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Romana requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business.

Romana has been in this business for eight years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cherryl is 36 years old and three of her children are in school.

Cherryl has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cherryl requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Cherryl has been in this business for four years. In the future, Cherryl would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Daryl

texts.en:
Daryl is 35 years old and married with two children.

Daryl works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Daryl has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from selling frozen food.

Daryl aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hydie

texts.en:
Hydie is 51 years old, a widow, and has three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Hydie has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, shampoo, sugar, and other groceries to sell.

Hydie has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Hydie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, shampoo, sugar, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sokheam's Group

texts.en:
Sokheam is a rural villager living in Kampong Thom province. She is 27 years old and a married mother of three children. One of them is in school while the other two are too young to attend school. 

Nowadays, her family's livelihood depends on cassava farming, growing cashew, and working on other farms for a fee. Sokheam has been involved in these businesses for more than five years and they earns her about 27,000 KHR per day. 

This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund while for the other three in her group, it is the first loan. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy a decent latrine. She hopes this loan will help her to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

loans.name: Lawan

texts.en:
Lawan is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kaza Village. Lawan joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Lawan will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, which is double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize. This will allow him to increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Lawan now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To increase his crop yield by purchasing additional farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more medicine, injections and medical equipment for her son's medical store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a Babban Gona farmer from Sabon garin Kuzuntu Village. She joined Babban Gona so that she could realise better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Maria no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for her children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see her increase her income considerably. This season Maria has ambitious plans to harvest 30 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Maria now has the opportunity to move to the City with her family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her maize yields

loans.name: Wunzooya, Kpataribogu Group

texts.en: Safura is 45 years old and married with five children. She is a member of a shea-butter processing group called ‘Wunzooya, Kpataribogu’ in the northern region of Ghana. Safura is the individual pictured sitting in front row with her hand raised.  Safura and her group have requested a loan of GHS 10,800. Her share of the loan is GHS 400.00, which she will use to buy shea nuts for processing. Safura and her group were trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process premium shea-butter for the local and export markets. She has a good market for her products and intends to earn more income to pay back the loan and cater to her children’s basic needs. Safura thanks Kiva lenders for their life changing support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Side Nooma Group

texts.fr: Fanta et son groupe viennent de finir leur premier prêt avec kiva. Les remboursements se sont bien passés. Fanta remercie kiva ainsi que tous les prêteurs pour le soutien. Avec le prêt, elle a pu payer des pagnes pour vendre et elle a eu un bénéfice qui lui a permis de s'occuper de sa famille. Fanta a besoin d'un nouveau prêt pour continuer son activité. Cette jeune dame âgée de 34 ans a déjà 10 ans dans son activité. Elle voudrait acheter 40 complets de pagne et des bijoux pour vendre. Après ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra de continuer son activité et s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Fanta and her group have just finished paying off their first loan from Kiva; their repayments were met on time. Fanta, as well as all the other borrowers, are thus very grateful to Kiva for its support. With the loan she was able to pay for "pagnes" (typical West African pieces of colorful fabric) that she sold, and she made enough profit to be able to provide for her family. Fanta needs a new loan now to continue her business. She is a 34-year old woman who has already been working for 10 years in her business. She would like to be able to buy 40 sets of "pagne" fabric and jewelry to sell. The profit she makes from the sale of her goods will enable her to continue with her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 40 sets of "pagne" fabric and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from e-loading (mobile prepaid loading). Elvie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Elvie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucia, de 45 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta quinto grado, no continuo sus estudios porque decidió acompañarse, está casada y tiene 6 hijos de 25, 23, 19, 18, 16 y 12 años de edad, de los cuales 2 de ellos estudian y los demás ya están casados, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería desde hace varios años.

Lucia, se dedica a la ganadería, a la agricultura, a la siembra de hortalizas y a la crianza de especies menores como cerdos y pollos de engorde desde hace varios años, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres y para llegar a su trabajo camina 3 kilómetros y su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. todos los días.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar una vaca lechera y 2 terneras para la crianza, de esta manera lograra aumentar la producción de leche.

El sueño de Lucia, es aumentar su hato ganadero y lechero para obtener ganancias y ahorrarlas para poder ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucia is 45 years old and a housewife. She only went to school until the 5th grade and did not continue because she decided to get married. She is still married and has 6 children who are 25, 23, 19, 18, 16 and 12 years old. Two of them are in school and the rest are married. Her husband has made a living in masonry for several years now. 

Lucia has made a living in livestock, agriculture, planting vegetables and raising small animals such as pigs and broiler chickens for several years. She learned this work from her parents. To get to work she walks 3 kilometers and her schedule is from 6:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M every day. The loan that she is asking for is to buy a dairy cow and 2 calves to raise. This way she will be able to increase milk production. Lucia's dream is to increase her livestock and dairy herd to get earnings and save them to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and 2 calves to raise.

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
Zaid is a twenty one year old single man, living in Wadi Mousa, Jordan, the location of Petra.  He is studying for his bachelor degree in Tourism and Tour Guiding.  He is working on his education because of the financial situation of his family. 

Recently Zaid is facing some problems that lead him to apply for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees.  Zaid`s future plan is to work in the field of tourism and he wishes to help his father with the household expenses.

loans.use: to help him cover his semester fees in Tourism and Tour Guiding, in order to help with his family income

loans.name: Neminda

texts.en: Neminda has a snack vending business. Since, she wants to be more productive, engaged in selling "longganisa" (processed meat). Her business is doing well when she doubles her time perfecting her own "longganisa" recipe. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keep pursuing her goals for the good of her family. Reason why she availed another loan from PMPC to buy more kilos of meat for her "longganisa" business. Today, she is able to help others do retailing business on her "longganisa" and they as well earned for their own family.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of meat for her "longganisa" business

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 63 years old and has seven children. Magdalena is married and has one child in school.

Magdalena is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Magdalena requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies.

Magdalena has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Magdalena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 57 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosalina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalina has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice production.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 44 years old, married and has one child.

Margie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Margie has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en:
Norn is ages 36 years old and a married father of three dependent children who are all in school, living in Kampong Cham province. To overcome his family’s hardship he grows cassava and rice as the main sources of his family’s income. Norn has been involved in this business for eighteen years and it earns him about 41,100KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for him with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, while the other one in his group is the first loan cycle. As a group leader, he will use his loan portion to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticide and pay for labor and plowing fees to support his farming. He hopes this loan will help him to earn more income to expand his cassava farmland and ability to keep sending his children to school until they get good job.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticide and pay for labor and plowing fees for his farming and to continue to send his children to school

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from egg retailing. Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
A mother of three children, with only one of them in school. Vanna lives in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province and she is 50 years old. To struggle with her family’s hardship, she earns an income via cassava and rice farming and works on other farms for a fee to earn more income for thirty-two years. Her family’s income is about 46,600KHR per day. 

Due to her cassava not growing well last year, it caused a decrease in her income. Now she has not enough funds for the farm, so she is leading a group to apply for the first Kiva loan via VisionFund. She will manage her loan portion to buy rice seed, pesticide and pay for labors fee for her farm. 

She hopes to have enough ability to expand her business in order to upgrade her family’s living and keep her children in school until their graduation.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, pesticide and pay for labors fee for her rice and cassava farm and keep her children in school

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy balconies for his house, so that his house is more secure for his family.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago lives in a community in the Department of Yoro Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (beans, coffee and corn). He is 59 years old, is married and has eight children. It is clear that Santiago works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system his children will be able to continue studying and that it will improve his family's living conditions.

Santiago is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
JESUS tiene 32 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos de 5 y 3 años los cuales cursan estudios en el colegio de la zona. En una parte rural, del distrito de Querocotillo, en la provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, Sierra Norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza es la de caporal de campo ,estas actividades las realiza en el caserío de Huancas y sectores aledaños esta labor le permite solventar el crédito sin ningún problema. El destino del crédito sera para invertir en servicios varios que realiza, como la compra y mantenimiento de herramientas y así generar mejores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jesus is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his spouse and their 2 young children of 5 and 3 years of age, who study at the local school. They live in a rural area of the Querocotillo District, in the Cutervo Province, Cajamarca Region, in the northern sierra of Peru.

He works as a field foreman in the village of Huancas and the surrounding areas. This job will allow him to pay off the loan without difficulties. The purpose of the loan he requests is to invest in the various services he performs, specifically in the purchase and maintenance of his tools. By doing so, he will be able to generate a greater income and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in the various services he performs as a field foreman, specifically in the purchase and maintenance of his tools.

loans.name: Elvis Judith

texts.es:
Elvis, de 44 años de edad, es ama de casa, su nivel de estudio fue hasta tercer grado, no continuo estudiando debido a la falta de recursos económicos, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 27, 26 y 24 años de edad, de los cuales solo 2 viven con ella y el otro está en los EE UU.

Elvis, tiene una pequeña granja de gallinas ponedoras desde hace varios años, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar tubos PVC para construir un drenaje de agua lluvia en su casa y para pagar mano de obra, con esto ayudara porque ya no se inundara cuando llueva.

Elvis, sueña con comprar un vehículo, para poder trasladar su producto hacia el mercado.
texts.en:
Elvis is 44 years old housewife. She studied until third grade due to lack of financial resources. She is a single mother of 3 children at the ages 27, 26 and 24. Two of them live with her and the other is in the USA.

Elvis has a small farm of hens to lay eggs. She has had the farm for several years. She learned this work from her parents.

Elvis requests a loan to buy PVC pipes to build a rainwater drain for her home and to pay for labor. This will help prevent flood when it rains.

Elvis hopes to buy a vehicle to transport the product to the market.

loans.use: to buy PVC pipes to build a rainwater drain for her home and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Amigas De Laura Caller Group

texts.es: Susy es una mujer de 26 años de edad es conviviente y tiene una hija de 2 años, pertenece al grupo "Amigas de Laura Caller" desde hace tres años donde cumple la función de Secretaria, Susy tiene un negocio de ventas de ganchos para niñas y también cuenta con un negocio de abarrotes gaseosas y cervezas, el negocio era de su madre luego paso a ser de ella,  donde lleva ya mas de 10 años, se siente muy orgullosa de poder lograr lo que hasta ahora tiene, sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, ya que se siente orgullosa de vender mercaderia de primera y sus clientes se van contentos y satisfechos por elloagradece a Kiva por el crédito porque así puede seguir creciendo en su negocio comprando mas mercadería como cerveza, gaseosas,arroz,azúcar,aceite y demás. Para ella no hay obstáculo que pueda vencerla por que su mayor motivación es su pequeña hija, "Gracias Kiva por la ayuda no los defraudare y luchare por salir siempre adelante con su ayuda".
texts.en:
Susy is a 26 year-old woman who lives with her partner and her 2 year-old daughter.  She has belonged to the "Amigas de Laura Caller" (Friends of Laura Caller) group for three years, and has the role of secretary. 

Susy has a business selling hangers for girls, and she also has a business selling groceries, soft drinks and beer. The business belonged to her mother, who then passed it on to her. 

She has been doing this for over ten years now, and is very proud of having been able to achieve what she has up to now. Her main customers are her neighbors, and she is proud to sell first-rate merchandise. Her customers are content and satisfied because of it.  She thanks Kiva for the loan because she can keep growing her business, buy more merchandise such as beer, soft drinks, rice, sugar, oil and other things.

For her, there are no obstacles that can stand in her way because her greatest motivation is her small daughter. “Thank you Kiva for the help – I will not let you down, and I will fight to get ahead always, with your help.”

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sugar, oil, rice, soft drinks and beer

loans.name: Carmen Magdalena

texts.es:
Carmen, de 36 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta bachillerato, no siguió estudiando porque decidió casarse, ahora en día tiene un hijo de 13 años de edad, el cual está estudiando, su esposo trabaja como vigilante en un negocio.

Carmen, se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente siembra granos básicos y hortalizas desde hace 15 años, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres, quienes siempre se han dedicado a este negocio, también tiene un cafetín en el centro educativo de su comunidad y para llegar a su trabajo camina 1 kilometro y su horario de trabajo es desde 7:00 a.m. a 4:30 p.m. 

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar insumos agrícolas, semilla, pesticidas y abono, para sembrar de 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 metros cuadrado de hortalizas, el crédito le ayudara para poder sacar una buena cosecha y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

El sueño de Carmen, es tener ganancias en su cafetín y poder ahorrar mucho para ampliar su negocio y así poder tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen, who is 36 years old, is a housewife, and studied up through high school but did not continue her studies because she chose to marry. Nowadays she has a 13 year old son who studies, and her husband works as a guard at a business.

Carmen has worked in agriculture, specifically in the sowing of basic grains and vegetables, for the past 15 years. She learned this trade from her parents, who have always worked in this business. She also owns a snack stand at her community's school. To get to work she has to walk 1 kilometer and works from 7:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy agricultural supplies, such as seeds, pesticides, and manure, so she can sow 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 square meters of other vegetables. The loan will help her get a good harvest and so be able to improve her family's quality of life.

Carmen's dream is to make good money with her snack stand so as to be able to save enough to expand her business, and therefore have a greater income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, such as seeds, pesticides, and manure, so she can sow 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 square meters of other vegetables.

loans.name: Mame's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 5 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 29 novembre 2009. Il est constitué de femmes du même quartier et des environs qui s'activent dans le commerce et ont de bonnes relations entre elles.
MAME  à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 6 garçons et 4 filles.L'ainé est âgée de 35 ans.Elle est la présidente du banc villageois.
Avec le prêt reçu elle va faire du commerce de divers produits au marché de Diourbel. Elle achète 1 sac de sucre à 27 500 FCFA soit à 500 FCFA le kilo et revend çà  600 FCFA. Elle achète aussi de la cola 80 kilo à 1200 FCFA le kilo et le cède à 1700 FCFA. Elle achète 20 kilo de café à 1500 FCFA le kilo et le cède à 1600 FCFA. Elle achète également 10 tissu wax pour 10 000 FCFA l'unité et le revend à 12 000 FCFA et enfin du thioup pour une valeur de 250 000 FCFA soit 15 000 FCFA l'unité et le cède à 19 000 FCFA.
Les bénéfices vont lui permettre de renforcer son commerce, satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants car son mari est à la retraite.
texts.en:
This group of five members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on November 29, 2009. It is composed of women from in and around the same district who are active in commerce. The women get along well with each other. MAME, at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is 57 years old and a married mother of ten children (6 boys and 4 girls). The oldest is 35 years old. She is the president of the 'banc villageois'.

After receiving the loan, she is going to do commerce in general goods in Diourbel. She is purchasing a bag of sugar worth 27,500 francs CFA, which is 500 francs per kilo, and resells it  at 600 francs. She is also purchasing 80 kg of cola at 1,200 francs per kilo and sells it at 1,700 francs. She is purchasing 20 kg of coffee at 1,500 francs per kilo and resells it at 1,600 francs. She is also purchasing 10 lengths of Wax cloth at 10,000 francs each and resells at 12,000 francs each. Finally, she is purchasing some “thioup” [a type of dyed fabric] worth 250,000 francs, which is 15,000 francs each, and sells it at 19,000 francs. 

The profits will enable her to bolster her business and meet the needs of her children, since her husband is retired.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cola, coffee, and fabrics

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 54 years old and is married with eight children. Four of her children are in school. For the past 12 years, Chona has run a fish-vending business in the Philippines.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Chona is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in the market. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Ladie

texts.en:
Ladie works hard to support her family. Ladie is married and has a plants seedlings business in the Philippines.

Ladie requested a PHP 35000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other supplies for her business.

Ladie has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Ladie would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other supplies for her business

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 23 years old and she lives in Salt with her family. She is studying for a degree in computer engineering and is working really hard to get ahead and to grow. May dreams of having a good job to help to pay for her daily expenses. She would like to give her family the things that they have not been able have. 

May is requesting a loan to pay for her educational expenses. She hopes to continue with her education and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her educational expenses

loans.name: Nabonswende De Bingo Group

texts.fr:
Mr AUGUSTIN est responsable du groupe NABONSWENDE DE BINGO. Marié, il est père d’un enfant. Il est âgé de 24mois et  ne va pas à l’école. Il a 02personnes en charge.
Mr fait l’agriculture et vend des céréales ???depuis plus de 40ans. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son village.
Il veut s’acheter 01 charrue, 01 âne et 30poules.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut renforcer son activité. Mr ambitionne devenir un grand agriculteur.
texts.en: Mr. Augustin the leader of the Nabonswende de Bingo group. He is married and has one child, who is 24 months old and does not attend  school. Augustin has two dependents. Augustin has been working as a farmer and selling cereals for over 40 years. He stocks up at the market in his village. He would like to buy a plow, a donkey and 30 chickens. With his loan, he will grow his business. His goal is to have a large farm.

loans.use: to buy a plow, a donkey and 30 chickens.

loans.name: Wendkouni N°1 De Bingo Group

texts.fr:
Mr KOUDBI BASILE est responsable du groupe WENDKOUNI N°1 DE BINGO. Marié, il est père d’un enfant. Il est âgé de 02ans et ne va pas à l’école.
Mr fait le maraichage depuis plus de 06ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Il veut s’acheter 02 boites de tomate, 01 boite d’oignons, 01boite de chou et 03 sac d’engrais.
Avec ses  bénéfices, il veut renforcer son activité. Mr ambitionne devenir un grand jardinier.
texts.en: Koudbi Basile is the leader of the Wendkouni N°1 De Bingo Group. He is a married father to one child, who is two years old and does not go to school. Koudbi Basile has been in market gardening for six years. He procures his goods from the local markets. He would like to purchase two boxes of tomatoes, one box of onions, one box of cabbages and three bags of fertilizer. With his earnings, he would like to improve his business. His ambition is to become a successful market gardener.

loans.use: to purchase two boxes of tomatoes, one box of onions, one box of cabbages and three bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 50 years old, married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, sugar, etc. to sell.

Virginia has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 50 years old and married with seven children. Five of her children are in school.

Luzviminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Luzviminda has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Luzviminda aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is married with a repair shop business in the Philippines. She has operated her business for 20 years and works hard to support her family. 

Catalina is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and other materials used for her repair shop. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and materials for her shop

loans.name: Koukilan Group

texts.fr:
Mme Marceline est responsable du groupe  KOUKILAN. Elle est veuve et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 37 ans et le moins âgé a 23ans. 01 enfant va à l’école et elle a 09 personnes en charge.
Madame vend la farine de pain de singe, la levure depuis 04 ans. Elle s’approvisionne à pô (village environnant).
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter 05 sacs de farine de pain de singe et 20 plats de levures.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne payer une parcelle.
texts.en:
Marceline is the representative of the Koukilan Group. She is widowed and mother to four children. Her eldest is 37 years old and her youngest is 23 years old. One of her children currently attends school and she has nine people living in her care. 

Marceline has been selling baobab flour for 4 years. She buys her stock from a neighbouring village. With this borrowed money, she is planning on purchasing five sacks of baobab flour and 20 packs of baking powder. She wants to use the profits from this loan to grow her business. Her aim is to be able to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of baobab flour and 20 packs of baking powder

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 55 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and she is the responsible mother of 4 children. Her husband is retired government servant and her son is running his own business by providing the services of medical clinic.

Naseem's son wants to purchase different types of check up tools and medicines for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her son is not in position to buy these medicines for his business purpose. Therefore Naseem has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her son to purchase these medicines and enable him to fulfill his business needs, so that her son can earn profitable income. Her son also plans to make savings with the income from his business to meet the uncertain events in future.

Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and medicines for her son's medical clinic

loans.name: Mardelyn

texts.en:
Mardelyn is a 22-year-old, high school graduate who lives in Bacolod City. She is married to Jerod, a fish-vendor. They have a two-year-old child. Their total monthly family income is only PHP 5,000 (USD 112). 

Mardelyn has long seen the need to help her husband, but she didn't have the means until she learned about the two-month training program of Bagosphere Ph Inc that could lead to a call center job. 

Now that she has passed Bagosphere's selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Once Mardelyn starts earning money, she can help provide for her family's basic needs and then save some money for her child's education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job that pays about USD 270 monthly.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 48 years old and married with six children. All of them are in school.

Evangeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Evangeline has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing.

Evangeline aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alona Mae

texts.en:
Alona Mae is a 20-year-old college graduate who lives in Bacolod City. She belongs to a family of seven. Alona Mae’s father is a welder and her mother is a housewife. She is the eldest and has four siblings: two in college, one in high school; and the youngest in elementary school. Her family’s total monthly income is 8,000 PHP which is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This financial reality has motivated Alona Mae to find the means to help her family. She braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully qualified for a two-month training program that could lead to a call center job that could pay 270 USD a month. 

Alona Mae is requesting a loan to pay tuition for her training program. Apart from helping her family, she also dreams to have a stable job and a happy family. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Alona Mae to have a better life.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a call center training program

loans.name: Dorinda

texts.en:
Dorinda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dorinda is 51 years old and has five children who are in school.

Dorinda has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Dorinda requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sleeping clothing, dresses, shoes, etc..

Dorinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Dorinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like sleep clothing, dresses, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en:
Marylou is a 19-year old high school graduate who lives in Silay City. She belongs to a family of 4. His father is deceased and her mother is a housewife. She has a younger sibling.  Her elder sister works in a computer shop in Bacolod City.  Their total monthly family income of Php 6,000 ($135) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. 

Marylou's need to find means to help the family is why she applied to join Bagosphere's 2-month training program. Marylou wants to improve her communication skills, have a stable job and a high salary. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Marylou achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 7 years. Elizabeth earns more income from baking and electronic mobile load retailing.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie is 44 years old and married with five children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Lorie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store like canned goods, sugar, junk foods, and other groceries.  Lorie has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, shampoo, coffee, salt, condiments, junk foods, and other groceries. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store like canned goods, sugar, junk foods, and other groceries

loans.name: G.s La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El G.S LA ESPERANZA ESTA CONFORMADO POR TRES INTEGRANTES, MADRES SOLTERAS CON SEIS HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIAS DE LA CONCEPCIÓN, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN, ESTAS JÓVENES MADRES  SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL. TODOS TIENE METAS Y OBJETIVOS DE VIDA, COMO  HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO, BRINDARLES ESTUDIOS A SUS HIJOS, Y DESEO DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL. LAMENTABLEMENTE NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN DÍA A DÍA PARA BRINDARLES A SUS HIJOS UN FUTURO MEJOR.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA  ES BLANCA Y TIENE COMO ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE PRENDA DE PLATA Y ORO, COSMÉTICOS Y ROPA, EL NEGOCIO LO DESEMPEÑA DE FORMA AMBULANTE POR ENCARGO Y EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN. ELLA TIENE  31 AÑOS DE TENER EL NEGOCIO, ACTIVIDAD QUE LA DESEMPEÑA DESDE MUY JOVEN PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES. ELLA DEDICA UNAS OCHOS HORAS DIARIAS A SU ACTIVIDAD, ACTIVIDAD QUE LA DESEMPEÑA CON MUCHO GUSTO YA QUE HA SIDO SU FORMA DE VIDA. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE PRENDA Y COSMÉTICOS COMO: CADENAS, ARETES, PULSERA, OMEGAS, RUBOR, SOMBRA, VANIDAD, LÁPIZ DE OJOS, ETC. PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS.  LA ESPERANZA  AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LES BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The  "La Esperanza" solidarity group consists of three members, single mothers who are responsible for six children. They are natives of La Concepción, a place that is located in the northern zone of the region. These young mothers are characterized by being hard-working and responsible, with the will for personal achievement. They all have goals and objectives in life, such as making their businesses grow, offering education to their children, and the desire for personal achievement. Unfortunately, they were not able to go to school. Now they strive day after day to offer their children a better future.

Thanks to her will to get ahead, Blanca is the coordinator. Her business is selling articles of silver and gold, cosmetics, and clothing. She carries out her business as a street vendor, by request, and in her home. She has had the business for 31 years; it is an activity that she has carried out since she was very young in order to help with the family expenses. She works some eight hours a day in her business, work that she does with great pleasure, since it has been her way of life. The purpose of her loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business of buying and selling jewelry products and cosmetics such as chains, earrings, bracelets, omega necklaces, blush, eye shadow, compacts, eye pencils, etc., so that in the not-too-distant future she can obtain better income. 

La Esperanza is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to persons of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of jewelry products and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 29 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jenalyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Jenalyn requested a PHP 21000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Jenalyn has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Jenalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nirza

texts.en:
Nirza is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nirza is 52 years old now.

Nirza has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Nirza requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Nirza has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Nirza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita works hard to support her family. Pacita is widow and has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fruits to sell.

Pacita has been in this business for 6 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Nathon Group

texts.en: Kernpheang is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Kernpheang and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Kernpheang and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Kernpheang and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Kernpheang and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell (gifts, clothes)

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
As a married mother of eleven children, Sarah works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending. Sarah is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to resell.

Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Rosalyne

texts.en:
Rosalyne is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalyne is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosalyne has a buy and sell frozen foods and dressed chicken business in the Philippines. Rosalyne requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods and dressed chicken to sell.

Rosalyne has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Rosalyne would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods and dressed chicken to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To assist with final payment for the store and renovations including shelving, equipment, ‎furniture and changing room pieces.‎

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 39 years old and has three children. Riza is married and has three children who are in school.

Riza is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Riza requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Riza has been in this business for 12 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Riza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is married with three children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Merlina is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Merlina requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Merlina has been in this business for 8 years.  In the future, Merlina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricel is 37 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Maricel has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional unit of bicycle for her business.

Maricel has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 61 years old and married with fourteen children. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Teresita has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soap, shampoo, candies, and other groceries. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en:
Ayat is 24 years old and lives in Irbid. Currently she is in the third stage of her degree in English language studies. She decided to study this subject because English is seen nowadays as being very important for her country's development.

Aside from being a very hardworking student, Ayat also tried to find good work outside her studies, but she could not find any. 

Ayat wants to specialize in English language studies. She is requesting her loan so she can pay the tuition instalments for her studies. 

Ayat is very grateful to the people who are helping her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay the tuition instalments for her studies.

loans.name: Mansurjon

texts.ru:
Мансурчон верный муж и примерный отец. Мансурчону 44 года. У него двое детей. Сыну 23 года, а дочке 19 лет. Он ответственный человек. Мансурчон слов на ветер не бросает и всегда выполняет свою работу в срок. Его работа заключается в том, что он строит глинные печи. Глинные печи используют почти все жители сел и деревень, так как у них нет электричества. Для них это способ приготовить пищу. Мансурчон научился этой работе у одного ремесленника и по сей день использует его советы в работе. Мансурчону помогает сын. Он учит сына этой деятельности и по техонку передает ему свое ремесло. Мансунчон за свою работу не требует много денег, так как понимает, что у жителей очень мало средств. 
  Причина обращения Мансурчона за заемными средствами является приобретения рабочих инструментов. Нынешние инструменты потеряли свою рабочею силу. Его собственные средства не позволяет ему купить инструменты для него и сына. Заемные средства помогут ему решить его проблему.
texts.en:
Mansurjon is a faithful husband and exemplary father. He is 44 years old, and has 2 children. His son is 23 years old, and his daughter is 19 years old. Mansurjon is a responsible man, true to his word, and always finishes his work on time. He works making earthen ovens. Almost every person who lives in a village uses an earthen oven, because they have no electricity. It is their means of preparing food.

Mansurjon learned this work from an artisan, and to this day uses his advice on the job. Mansurjon's son helps him. Mansurjon is teaching him this occupation, and quietly passing his trade on to him. Mansurjon does not ask much money for his work, because he understands that the local residents have very little money.

The reason that Mansurjon has applied to borrow money is so he can get some tools for his work. The tools he is using now have become too worn out to use. His own income is not enough to allow him to buy tools for him and his son. Borrowing money will help them to solve this problem.

loans.use: to buy tools for his work.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a hardworking entrepreneur with 3 children. She runs a bakery in the Philippines, and she has requested a 50,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional ingredients for her bakery.

Merlita successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Merlita dreams that one day she will be able to continue building and expanding her business so she can secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Alba Nely

texts.es:
Alba, de 38 años de edad, creció con sus padres, estudio hasta segundo grado, sus padres trabajaron en la agricultura y en la albañilería, está casada y su esposo se dedica a los trabajos en la agricultura, siembra maíz y frijoles, es madre de tres hijos, 2 de sus hijos se dedican a los trabajos de jornaleros y en diferentes labores que conllevan para el sustento para la familia.

Alba, trabaja desde joven en la venta de tamales, vende dos veces a la semana, su mamá fue quien le enseño.- Además, vende atol y pan artesanal en la comunidad; también trabaja en la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles; junto a su familia han sembrado 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y de frijoles, también tiene crianza de especies menores.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar fertilizantes para sus cultivos y también para compra dos cerdos, así ella podrá asegurar la alimentación de su familia.

Ella sueña con poder seguir trabajando y aumentado la venta de tamales pues les es rentable, además espera comprar una tarea de tierra para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Alba, who is 38 years old, grew up with her parents. She went to school through second grade. Her parents worked in agriculture and in masonry. She is married, and her husband does agricultural work. She raises corn and beans. She is the mother of three children. Two of her children do day labor, doing various work with which they contribute to the sustenance to the family.

Alba has worked selling tamales since she was young. She sells two times a week. Her mother was the one who taught her [this work]. In addition, she sells atol [a cornflour drink] and home-made bread in the community. She also plants basic grains such as corn and beans. She and her family have planted 3500 square meters of corn and beans. She also raises small animals.

The loan that she is applying for is to buy fertilizers for her crops and also to buy two pigs. Thus she will be able to assure the feeding of her family.

She dreams of being able to continue working and increasing her sales of tamales, since it is profitable for them. In addition, she hopes to buy a plot of land to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her crops and also to buy two pigs.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 22-year-old college undergraduate who lives in Bacolod City. He belongs to a family of 10. His father works as a company driver, and his mother works as a household helper. He has 7 siblings, and he is the eldest. 2 sisters also work as household helpers in Manila, while his other sisters are still in school. 

Anthony previously worked in a local convenience store. The family's monthly income of 15,000 PHP is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. 

Wanting to provide for his family's needs has motivated Anthony to join BagoSphere's 2-month training program. He aims to have a stable job with a high salary. He wants to one day run a computer repair and maintenance business to help his family battle poverty. 

Your support in funding his  loan will help Anthony have a better life.

loans.use: to pay the tuition for a 2-month call center training program, with which he can get a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: Toshbibi

texts.ru: Тошбиби милая 43-летняя женщина. Замужем, имеет 4 несовершеннолетних детей. Живет с мужем в сельской местности, имеет среднее образование. Однако уже на протяжении 10 лет занимается разведением и выращиванием скота. Для расширения поголовья скота Тошбиби необходимо дополнительное финансирование и она обратилась за помощью и надеется, что просьба ее не будет отклонена.
texts.en: Toshbibi is a sweet 43-year-old woman. She is married, and has 4 children who are not yet adults. She lives with her husband in the country, and has a secondary education. For 10 years, she has been raising and breeding livestock. In order to expand her headcount of livestock, Toshbibi requires additional financing. She has applied for help, and hopes that her request will not be denied.

loans.use: to increase her number of livestock.

loans.name: Albaro

texts.es:
Albaro tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y 3 menores hijos en casa de material rústico en el Sector Loma Chuncha - Caserío El Arenal Distrito de Santo Tomas, es una comunidad pequeña dedicada basicamente a la agricultura y ganaderia, se dedicada al cultivo de café, caña de azúcar, productos de pan llevar, menestras, crianza de aniamales menores y otros; ubicada en la provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café variedad catimor.Tambien cultiva caña de azúcar desde hace cinco años, para destilacion de aguardiente de manera artesanal, una bebida tradicional de la sierra del Perú, que es utilizada en festividades, antiseptico y curaciones.Además cría animales menores, para la venta y consumo. Albaro ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa para mantenimiento de su cultivos de 2 has de café en producción y de esta manera tener una mejor producción y cosecha para venderlo, generando mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Albaro is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and 3 young children in a house made of rustic material in the Loma Chuncha sector of the small village El Arenal. It is in the Santo Tomas district, and it is a community basically dedicated to agriculture and livestock. They make their living by growing coffee, sugarcane, legumes, and other basic crops, and raising small animals etc. His community is located in the Cutervo province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He works in farming, especially catimor coffee production. For the past five years he has also grown sugarcane to be artisanally distilled to aguardiente, which is a traditional drink in the Peruvian mountains. It is used at festivals, as an antiseptic, and medicinally. He also raises small animals to sell and eat.

Albaro has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative to maintain his 2-hectare coffee plantation. In this way, he will have better production and a better harvest, generating a higher income and improving his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his 2-hectare coffee plantation

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married mother of 8 children, Lucia works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling coconut wine.  

Lucia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional boxes of fish to sell from her fish vending business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities with help from her previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Triunfo Epifanio

texts.es:
Triunfo Epifanio tiene 51 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y una hija de 22 años de edad, hija esta en preparación (academia), vive en casa propia de material rústico de piedra. Vive en una comunidad pequeña llamada Viza,dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganaderia; dicho caserío se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, sierra Norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Triunfo Epifanio es la agricultura, cultivo de café 1ha variedad catimor,y productos de pan llevar (vituca, yuca, maiz y menestras), cría de animales menores (gallinas, chanchos y cuyes), cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente es docente Nombrado de Educación Secundaria en el caserio viza, labora hace 8 años.

El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de dicho cultivo, con ello obtendrá buena producción y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Triunfo Epifanio is 51 years old. He has a stable household [where he lives] at the side of his wife and a 22-year-old daughter. His daughter is in school. He lives in his own house made of rustic stone. He lives in a small community called Viza, where people basically work in agriculture and livestock raising. This village is located in the district of San Tomás, in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region on the northern coast of Peru.

The work that Triunfo Epifanio does is agriculture. He raises coffee and plants one hectare of coffee of the catimor variety and staple food products (root crops, yucca, corn, and vegetables). He raises small animals (hens, pigs, and guinea pigs). He has a lot of experience in this work. In addition, he is a secondary school teacher in the town of Viza, where he has worked for 8 years.

The purpose of the loan will be the maintenance of his crop, with which he will obtain good production and greater income to thus be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee planting.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reina, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, creció con sus padres, está acompañado desde hace 11 años, su compañero de vida trabaja sembrando maíz, frijoles y maicillo y sembrar hortalizas como tomate, pepino y ejotes, tiene dos hijos.

Reina, ha trabajado en la agricultura, este trabajo se lo enseño su papá desde pequeña, actualmente cultiva maíz y frijoles junto a su esposo, trabaja desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta el mediodía, luego comienza con el negocio de la crianza de aves de corral.

Reina, está solicitando un crédito para comprar dos sacos de fertilizantes, para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, esto le ayuda para poder seguir con sus ingresos económicos y poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Reina, es poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos, para que puedan terminar sus estudios y puedan ser personas de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
27-year-old Reina went to school until fourth grade and grew up with her parents. She has been in a committed relationship for 11 years. Her life partner works growing corn, beans, and sorghum, and he grows green vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers, and green beans. She has two children.

Reina has worked in farming. Her father taught her this trade since she was little. She currently grows corn and beans along with her partner. She works from 6am until noon. Later, she starts work on her poultry-raising business.
