Reina is requesting a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizers, to grow 7,000 square meters of corn. This will help her be able to continue receiving monetary income and give her family a better quality of life.

Reina's dream is to be able to continue supporting her children, so that they can finish their studies and serve society.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of fertilizer, to grow 7,000 square meters of corn

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines.

Bernadeth has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional equipment such as a hair dryer, a manicure and pedicure set, scissors, etc.

Bernadeth has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Bernadeth would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment such as a blow dryer, a manicure and pedicure set, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary works hard to support her family. Mary is single and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials, such as spare parts, lights and paint.

Mary has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials, such as spare parts, lights and paint

loans.name: Jose Marie

texts.en:
Jose Marie is 42 years old and has four children. He is married and all of his children are sent to school.

Jose Marie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jose Marie requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise his pigs.

Jose Marie has been raising pigs for twenty-one years, and he has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jose Marie would like to save enough money to expand his business and continue to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise his pigs.

loans.name: Chandana

texts.en:
Chandana hails from Falakata. She is a 29-year-old, married woman living with her spouse and two sons in the village of Parengerpar in Falakata, Alipurduar district. She attended school up to grade 8. One of her sons reads in grade 1, and the other one is a toddler. 

Chandana is a homemaker and also runs her own small clothing business. Her husband, Subhash, is a carpenter by profession. Chandana sells saris to her neighbors, relatives and friends from her home. A sari is a traditional women's garment consisting of a length of cotton or silk elaborately draped around the body. In India, saris have a good demand in all seasons, and in festival season, the demand doubles.  

Due to the continuous price growth of her family's basic needs, she wants to enhance her business. As Chandana has a good relationship with her customers, she needs to buy more saris to satisfy them according to their seasonal demand. But the lack of adequate capital is the major problem for her. So she took a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to increase the inventory with varieties of saris for her business. 

She hopes the variety in the stock will attract more customers and she will earn more profit. It will enable her to create the financial stability for her family’s well being. With the profit outcome, she dreams of making a concrete house in the future. 

Chandana thanks Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase more saris (a traditional women's dress) for her clothing business.

loans.name: Lakhsmi

texts.en:
Lakhsmi is an inhabitant of Falakata. She is 26 years old and resides with her husband and their only son. Her son is a preschooler. 

Lakhsmi's husband is engaged in a firewood business. Lakshmi also helps her husband in this business. Their potential customers are their neighbors. They purchase logs from his village and neighboring villages and cut them into small pieces to resell to his neighbors. There is a great demand for firewood in his locality. They have chosen this business as firewood is used as a fuel for cooking in rural west Bengal. But due to lack of capital, he cannot expand this business. 

Lakhsmi, who is a sensitive and intelligent lady, understands that the only way out is to get some loan through which they can expand their business and thereby, they can earn more income. She has applied for a loan from Kiva through BJS to purchase more logs for this business. 

She is very much hopeful that this investment will fetch her more income to fulfill her dream of opening a shop in the future that will be an additional income-generating source.

loans.use: to purchase logs to expand the firewood business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell and to buy supplies to make repairs

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year old Anima is a very committed and hardworking woman from Falakata. She is a mother of two lovely daughters; one is married and another is a student of class 11. They live in the small village of Parengerpar in Falakata, in the district of Alipurduar.  They have their own kachha house (made of straw, bamboo, and mud). Both Anima and her husband were deprived of education in their childhood due to their families' financial issues.

Her husband, Mati, is a paddy (rice) grower. Anima helps her husband every day to keep their crop healthy, which is a laborious and difficult job. The family depends on this agribusiness since it is their sole source of income. They have been selling the produce in the local town market. However, a major part of the harvest is sold to the wholesale dealers in the market. 

They earn barely enough to cover all the household expenses, so the couple needs to cultivate paddy in larger quantities. This will not only meet the customers' demands, but also earn them additional profit. To achieve this, Anima is seeking a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to purchase more good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for better cultivation. 

She hopes for good revenue from this to meet all her dreams. She wants to support her daughter with a good education to be successful in her career. She also aspires to acquire more land with the profit.  

She gives heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase farm resources for paddy (rice) cultivation.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezel is 39 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Liezel has a general store business in the Philippines. Liezel requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Liezel has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money to expand her business and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mitchel Adrian

texts.en:
Mitchel Adrian is an 18-year-old college undergraduate who lives in Hinigaran with his parents and 2 siblings. His father is retired and his mother is a housewife. His older brother works as an IT personnel in a local shop, while his younger sister is in high school. The family's monthly income of Php 7,000 is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. Apart from helping his family, Mitchel Adrian wants to learn about the BPO industry, improve understanding of computer technology, become an effective communicator and have a stable job with high income. 

Your help in funding his loan, will enable him to enroll in Bagosphere’s training program and begin the journey to a better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthlyhttps://partners.kiva.org/img/h450/1901052.jpg

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Monaliza works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Monaliza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Monaliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Louiella

texts.en:
Louiella is a 20-year-old high school undergraduate who lives in Bacolod City. She belongs to a family of 10. Her father works as construction laborer and her mother is a housewife. She has 6 younger and 1 older sibling. Her oldest brother works as a construction laborer, while her 4 other brothers are still studying in high school and in elementary school. Their total monthy family income is only Php 12,000 ($269). 

Louiella's aspiration to find a means to help the family is the reason she joined Bagosphere. Apart from helping her family, Louiella also wants to become a computer system analyst. 

Your generosity in funding her loan will go along way in helping Louiella achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Kc Lyn

texts.en:
KC Lyn is a 23-year-old college undergraduate and lives in a rural village in Bago City. She is married to Bernard Jr., who works as a Supervisor at Pagcor-Manila. They have 1 child aged 8 months old. KC Lyn is living with her parents. Their total monthly family income is only Php 12,000. KC Lyn has long seen the need to help her husband but didn’t have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. 

Now that she has passed Bagosphere’s selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Once KC Lyn starts earning, she can help provide for her family’s basic needs and then save some money for her child’s education and have a better, happy, and stable family life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 26-year-old married father of one child. Two years ago, he opened a mobile phones shop to cover his family's needs and expenses. He succeeded through the years in gaining loyal customers, but he is still facing hard competition.

Today, Ali is trying hard to develop his business, thus he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise with a new collection of mobile phones and prepaid cards to satisfy his customers' needs and attract new ones.

Ali hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and stay capable of improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with a new collection of mobile phones and prepaid cards

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra is 25 years old, single and lives in the Siem Reap province in Cambodia. She is studying accounting in her third year at university in the province. 

She has also worked for a guesthouse as a receptionist since 2014, making USD 3.66 per day. Ra is lacking the finances to pay her tuition fees from her third year through her fourth year, so she would like a loan. This loan will help her have enough finances to earn a bachelor’s degree and gain important skills for her future job. 

After graduation, she hopes to have a good job with a decent salary, so she will be able to save money to run her own business. She also dreams of having her own house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from her third year through her fourth year

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Virginia is 48 years old and all of her children are sent to school.

Virginia has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell to customers.

Virginia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell to customers.

loans.name: Champa

texts.en:
Champa is a thriving and hardworking woman of Parengerpar village in Falakata. She has a higher secondary grade education. At 43 years old and as the mother of two sons, Champa is running her household with great effort and dedication. Her sons are also receiving higher education with the help of their mother’s inspiration. 

Her husband, Paritosh, is a service man by profession. His income is not quite satisfactory and is unable to meet all the demands of his family.  So to help her husband, Champa has started a sewing service. She mainly stitches bags, market bags and sacks according to the market orders. Besides these, she also makes clothing such as blouses, petticoats, salwar suits, frocks and many others as per customer order. She works alone all day to support her husband financially and extrude the economic burden of supplying household resources.

Champa wants to expand her sewing work and generate more income to ensure economic stability and give her family a better quality of life. So she has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase a sewing machine for enhancing her sewing business to supply her products in bulk on time. 

She hopes it will enable her to satisfy her valuable customers and market stores and can remove the financial burden in her family, educate her children properly and run the business smoothly. Her future dream is to buy more modernized sewing machines for her business.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for enhancing her sewing business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a 35-year-old high school graduate and lives in La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She is married to Ryan, who works as an overseas foreign worker in Dubai. They have 3 children ages 14, 12, and 1. The eldest is in high school and the other in elementary school. Their total monthly family income is only Php 16,000. Maribel has long seen the need to help her husband but didn’t have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of Bagoshere that could lead to a call center job. 

Once Maribel starts earning, she can provide for her family's basic needs. Maribel dreams to have a stable job with a high salary, to have financial security, and to send her children to a better school. With your support in funding her loan, she can enroll in Bagosphere's training program and can have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a 25-year-old high school graduate and lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of 5. Her father works as a farm laborer, and her mother is a housewife. Mylene has been living with her aunt for 5 years, and she works in a local computer shop. Her eldest sister is already married and her brother is a farm laborer. Their total monthly family income of Php 7,000 is barely enough to provide for their basic needs.  This motivates Mylene to find means to help the family have more income, which is why she braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job.  

Apart from helping her family, Mylene wants to boost her self-esteem, to become a successful call center agent, to continue her studies, and to have a stable job with a high salary. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Mylene have a better income and a better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Lucenie

texts.en:
Lucenie is a 22-year-old high school graduate and lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of 5. Her father works as a jeepney driver, and her mother is a housewife. Lucenie is the second in their family. Her eldest sister is married and her youngest brother works as a jeepney driver. Their total monthly family income of Php 8,000 is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This motivates Lucenie to find a means to help the family have more income, which is why she braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. 

Apart from helping her family, Lucenie dreams to become a successful call center agent, to continue her studies in college and to improve the life of her family. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Lucenie have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger griddle

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru:
Хосият начинающая предпринимательница из района Шахритус. Ей 53 года. Она работает санитаркой в больнице. С возрастом ей тяжелее работать в этой деятельности, и она решила открыть свой малый бизнес у себя дома. Хосият планирует купить двух или трех телят откормить их в течение 2-3 месяцев и после перепродать с наценкой на скотном рынке. 
  Хосият очень скучает по сыну, который находится на заработках заграницей. Работая на скотном дворе, она проведет время с пользой, с удовольствием и отвлечется от мыслей. Хосият просит заемных средств для приобретения пару голов скотин. Она нуждается в поддержке.
texts.en:
Khosiyat is a businesswoman, just starting out, from the Shahrituz region. She is 53 years old, and she works as a nurse at a hospital. With age, it has become harder to perform her work, and she has decided to start her own small business from her home. Khosiyat plans to buy two or three calves, fatten them up over 2-3 months, and then resell them for a profit at the livestock market.

Khosiyat really misses her son, who is a migrant worker living abroad. Working with livestock, Khosiyat will be using her spare time to her advantage, for her enjoyment, and will be distracted from her thoughts. Khosiyat is requesting to borrow money to buy a pair of livestock. She needs support.

loans.use: to start a new livestock-raising business.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Estrellitas” está conformada por 05 socios responsables. Este es el caso de Paulina de 56 años casada con 02 hijos. Paulina es una madre empeñosa que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Actualmente se dedica  a la venta y crianza de aves, la cual lo realiza a pedidos. Se siente feliz pues cada vez mejora su economía. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales. El anhelo de paulina es de seguir mejorando su negocio. El grupo “las estrellitas” agradece a las personas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Paulina  es la tercera del lado derecho y viste chompa color blanco con celeste.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Estrellitas" (The Little Stars) consists of 5 responsible members. 

This is the situation of Paulina: She is 56 years old and is married with two children. Paulina is a hard-working mother who with great effort and dedication has managed to help her partner with the household expenses. She now works raising and selling poultry, which she does by order. She feels happy since with each sale she improves her economic situation. At this time she is applying for the loan to purchase feed for her animals. Paulina's desire is to continue improving her business. Paulina is the third one from the right, wearing a white sweater with blue.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 64-years-old, married with eight children. 

Angelina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Angelina requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Angelina has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Miguel Rafael

texts.en:
Miguel Rafael is an 18-year-old college under graduate and lives in Bago City. He belongs to a family of 4. His father works as a tricycle driver and his mother is a housewife. Miguel Rafael is the eldest in the family, and his sister is in high school. Their total monthly family income of Php 6,000 ($137) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. 

Miguel needs to find a means to help the family, which is why he braved the selection process of Bagosphere's 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Apart from helping his family, Miguel wants to become an excellent call center agent, to have a higher salary and to become a successful businessman. 

Your generosity in funding his loan will help Miguel to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Fayza's Group

texts.en:
Fayza and Sanaa are friends from childhood. Fayza is 48 years old and a married woman, and Sanaa is 41 years old and a divorced woman. 

They are working hard to be productive women in their community. They like cooking and they are talented in it; therefore, they decided to start their own business to get them income.

Fayza and Sanaa started their business seven years ago, and they are getting a good income from it. They cook many kinds of food and sell it to the schools or restaurants.

Now they want to expand their work and to deal with a lot of restaurants to sell them food; that's why they applied for a loan to promote their food and to buy tools and supplies to increase their products and increase their income to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to promote her food and to buy tools and supplies

loans.name: Ma. Dyanne

texts.en:
Ma. Dyanne is a 19-year-old college undergraduate and lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of 7. Her father works as a farmer, and her mother is a housewife. Ma. Dyanne is the 2nd youngest in the family, and she has 4 siblings. Her two elder sisters are married and work in a local gasoline station. Her elder brother is unemployed, and her younger brother is in high school. Their total monthly family income of Php 7,000 ($157) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This motivates Ma. Dyanne to find a means to help the family to have more income, which is why she braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. 

Apart from helping her family, Ma Dyanne also dreams to become a successful call center agent and to have her own house someday. She also wants to help the less fortunate. 

Your generosity in funding her loan will help Ma. Dyanne have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Joemarie

texts.en:
Joemarie is a 22-year-old high school graduate and lives in a rural village in Bacolod City. He belongs to a family of 9. His father is unemployed due to old age, and his mother is a housewife. Joemarie is the youngest in the family, and he has 6 siblings. Two of his sisters are overseas foreign workers in Malaysia and Kuwait. Their total monthly family income of Php 15,000 ($339) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This motivates Joemarie to find a means to help the family have more income, so he underwent the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. 

Joemarie aims to finish his training and help his family provide for their basic needs. Joemarie would like to enhance his communication skills and communicate with other people. His biggest dream is to become a successful call center agent for a prestigious BPO company. 

Your generosity in funding his loan would greatly help Joemarie to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Sandra Rose

texts.en:
Sandra Rose works hard to support her family and has a buy and sell foods business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase products for her business, such as dried fish and dried cashews.

Sandra Rose has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Sandra Rose would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase products for her business, such as dried fish and dried cashews

loans.name: Mary Elaine

texts.en:
Mary Elaine is a 19-year old college under graduate and lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of 5. She is the 2nd in the family. Her father works as a construction foreman and her mother works as a packer in a local factory. Her eldest brother has been working in a local machine shop in Manila for 3 years, while her youngest sister is in high school.  Their total monthly family income of Php 15,000 ($337) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs.

Apart from helping her family, Mary Elaine wants to be a great communicator, to continue her studies, to have a high paying job, and also to better the life of her family. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Mary Ellaine reach her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Dúo Torre Liana Group

texts.es: Dúo Torre liana: este Grupo esta conformado por la señora Maudelia de 42 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de usos domesticos; Cubrecamas,colchas,etc. tiene ya varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, por tal motivo solicita este credito para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio. espera que la puedan seguir apoyando en su negocio.
texts.en: This group includes Maudelia, who is 42 years old.  She makes a living selling products of domestic uses, such as bedspreads and quilts.  She has been in this business for several years.  For that reason, she is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise for her business.  She hopes that this will make it possible to continue supporting her business.

loans.use: to purchase domestic use products to sell (bedspreads, blankets, etc.).

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
JUANA ROSA TIENE 51 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE CON SUS 2 HIJOS,EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD GRANDE EN LA ZONA URBANA DE CAYALTI,QUE PERTENECE A LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGIÓN LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DEL PERÚ. Y GOZA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES DE PARTE DE SUS VECINOS.

ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE VENTA DE ROPA Y PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA, DESDE HACE MAS DE 8 AÑOS DE ANTIGUEDAD EN EL NEGOCIO, EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO. SOLICITA PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA COMO PRENDAS DE VESTIR PARA DAMAS, CABALLEROS Y NIÑOS. DE ESTA MANERA HACER CRECER MAS SU NEGOCIO,OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Juana Rosa is 51 years old and lives with her two children in her own house in a large community in the urban area of Cayalti, which is part of Chiclayo province in Lambayeque region on Peru's north coast. She has good personal and work references from her neighbors.  

She has been selling clothing and beauty products for more than eight years from a business located in her own home. She is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise such as articles of women's, men's and children's clothing. In this way she hopes to make her business grow, earn more income and  improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as articles of women's, men's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell and to purchase six hundred pounds of corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen, 31 years old, is living in a community in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farm, which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 10 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 4.00 a day. She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Honeylyn

texts.en: Honeylyn is a 24-year old vocational school graduate and lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of 11. Her father works as a farm laborer and her mother is a housewife. She has nine siblings. Three are already married, two of her brothers are working in Manila as custom and a security guard, two sisters are working as housemaids in Bacolod City, one has her own small business, and the youngest is in college. Their total monthly family income of PHP 18,000 ($404) is barely enough to provide for all their basic needs. This motivates Honeylyn to find means to help the family have more income and that’s why she braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the two-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Apart from helping her family, Honeylyn’s ultimate goal is to have a successful career in the BPO industry, to develop her communication skills, to learn new languages, to uplift her family from poverty and to help the less fortunate. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Honeylyn to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 20-year old college undergraduate who lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of five. Her father works as a mechanic operator and her mother is a housewife. Catherine is the eldest child and has two siblings. Her brother is in college while her sister is in high school. The family’s total monthly income of PHP 14,000 ($314) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This motivates Catherine to find means to help the family’s income. Catherine’s dream is to work in a BPO industry with a high salary and improve her English. Your support in funding her loan will help Catherine achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is an 18-year-old college undergraduate and lives with her parents and two siblings in La Castellana. Her father works as a farm laborer and her mother is a housewife while her two siblings are in high school. Christine is the eldest in the family and used to work in a local bakery in Bago. The family's monthly income of PHP 10,000 ($224) is not enough for their sustenance. Christine would like to earn more for herself and for her family, and she believes that the training at Bagosphere will allow her to realize this goal. Christine wants to work in a BPO company that provides a high standard of customer service along with a good salary. She aims to improve her English, help her family, and send her siblings to college once she gets a stable job.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a 60-year-old widow residing in Talibon, Bohol.  She has one grown child. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, powdered milk, beverages and toiletries. For almost 15 years now, Leonida has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted soft drinks like Pepsi, Coke and Royal. With these, she can now improve the contents of her store and be able to cater to the needs of her customers. In this way, she can set aside some savings for emergency purposes. She can now start to expand her business for a sustainable living.

Leonida is very grateful for the funds she availed and she is determined to handle them properly to be successful.

loans.use: to buy assorted soft drinks

loans.name: Dúo Vía Argentina Group

texts.es:
Dúo Vía Argentina: Zulma Lorena tiene 34 años de edad,madre de un niño el cual estudia y es menor de edad
Zulma juntamente con su esposo Mateo se dedican a la venta de automóviles usados
Los cuales vienen del extranjero. Ella hace 2 años se dedica al negocio y por aparte en su actividad secundaria
Vende cosméticos y zapatos. Zulma es una mujer emprendedora que desea llegar muy lejos
Con su esfuerzo y actitud en su negocio, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos y calzado para vender.
texts.en: The "Vía Argentina" duo: Zulma Lorena is 34 years old and is the mother of a dependent son who is in school. Zulma and her husband Mateo sell used cars which they import from abroad. Zulma has been in this business for two years, and as an additional source of income she sells cosmetics and shoes. She is an entrepreneurial woman who wants to go very far. With the hard work and good attitude she puts into her business, she is requesting this loan to purchase cosmetics and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to supply clients with milk and meet their demands for milk supply.

loans.name: Charie

texts.en:
Charie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Charie is 29 years old and has two children who are in school.

Charie has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Charie has been in this business for six years. In the future, Charie would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 42-year-old married mother of two who opened her own housewares shop in 2012. She supports her husband who specializes in concrete work.  Together, they try to cover their family's increasing needs and requests.

Abir is a hard worker and an ambitious woman who is trying desperately to develop her business. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new special items to satisfy her customers' special requests. 

Abir hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new special items to satisfy her customers' special requests

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 18 years old and is first of two children in the family.

Her mother Marlyn is borrowing a PHP 4,297 loan through NWTF to pay for her daughter's tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Madelyn is currently in the second year of her four-year Bachelor of Science in criminology course.

When she graduates, Madelyn plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a welding machine, and also two sacks of fertilizer for beans and corn.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 64 años de edad, conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo , vive en casa propia, domiciliado en la CAS : EL CHORRO en el DISTRITO de la FLORIDA, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra Norte del Perú;la cual es una zona rural.

Él se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería; hace 3 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; compra de una mochila para fumigar; esto le servira para trabajar en mejores condiciones y para poder brindar mejores servicios, lo que producirá que se generen mayores ingresos y pueda mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Antonio, 64, is married and has no kids at home. He owns the house where he lives in El Chorro, in the Florida district of the Cajamarca region, a rural zone located in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has worked as a day laborer for three years. He asks for a loan to buy a backpack used for fumigation. This will allow him to work in better conditions and to be able to provide better services. Thus he will produce greater income and can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a fumigation backpack.

loans.name: Ilcia Aridai

texts.es:
Ilcia, de 25 años de edad, es una joven luchadora que desde muy pequeña quedo a cargo de su tío, porque sus padres emigraron al extranjero para poderle dar un futuro mejor a ella, ha sido muy independiente desde pequeña, actualmente está cursando 3 año de la carrera Administración de Empresas, desde pequeña ella se sintió identificada con esta carrera.

Ilcia, con mucho esfuerzo y con ayuda de sus padres coloco su propio negocio de venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños y tiene 4 años de tener este negocio; hasta la fecha le ha dado muy buenos frutos y ahora a diversificados sus productos y también vende cosméticos, la venta de ropa la tiene en la casa de una prima y ella le apoya cuando Ilcia va a estudiar.

Ilcia, necesita el crédito para surtir más su negocio y comprar otra variedad de ropa y otra parte del dinero para cancelar la cuota del nuevo ciclo que iniciara en la universidad. 

Ella sueña con tener su propio local, que sea grande y que este en un lugar estratégico para vender más sus productos.- Además, desea continuar con sus estudios para lograr culminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Ilcia, 25, is a hardworking young woman who has lived with her uncle from a young age because her parents emigrated in order to give her a better future. She's always been very independent. Currently, she is in her third year of a bachelors degree in Business Administration, a career that she has identified with from a young age.

Ilcia, through her hard work and with the help of her parents, set up a store selling clothing for men, women and children. She has been running the store for four years, and has so far seen very good results. She has since diversified, and has added cosmetics sales as well. The store is located in her cousin's home, and her cousin helps out while Ilcia is in school.

Ilcia needs a loan to stock her store with a greater variety of clothing, and also to pay for her ninth semester of university. Her dream is to have her own big store in a strategic location so she can sell more product. She also wants to finish her college courses and get her degree.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of clothing to stock her store, and to pay for her next semester of university.

loans.name: Gladys Mae

texts.en:
Gladys Mae is a 39-year old vocational graduate who lives in Bacolod City. She is married to Ronie, who works as a jeepney driver. They have six children between the ages of 3 and 20. Her eldest daughter works in a call center, while two of her sons  are in college. Her other son is in high school, while the other two children are in preschool. 

Gladys currently works as a food vendor and earns PHP 3,000 ($67). The family's monthly income of only PHP 16,000 ($360) is not enough to provide for their family's basic needs. Thus, when Gladys qualified for the two-month call center training program of BagoSphere, she saw a glimmer of hope for a chance for her to improve her family’s life. 

Gladys dreams to have a stable job and earn a good salary, to become a successful businesswoman and to send her children to a better school. Your tuition loan assistance might just allow her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 so as to benefit from the training, especially in enterprise development. 

She practices mixed farming whereby she keeps a dairy cow and also grows maize, beans and potatoes. She sells her dairy and farm produce in the local market. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds for her dairy cow, which will increase her milk production. This will also increase her milk sales for more income to pay school fees for her children, and will also meet her customers' demands.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy dairy feeds to increase milk production, and hence, earn more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Bunthoeun, 50 years old, is living in a community of Kandal Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing vegetable for sale. So far, she has been in this type of business for around five years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD $1.60 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of retail general goods like cooking fat, baking flour, maize flour, washing detergent and milk

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Edmarie is 19 years old and is the last of five children in the family. Her mother, Marciana, supports the family through her buy-and-sell assorted products business in the Philippines.

Edmarie is studying a Bachelor's of, Agricultural Technology and is currently in the final year of this 4-year-course. 

Marciana is borrowing PHP 3,581 through NWTF to pay her daughter's tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Edmarie plans to become employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 54 years old, married and a father of four children. Three of his children are currently attending school. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the training, especially in enterprise development. 

He practices mixed farming, where he keeps dairy and also does crop farming. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy certified seeds and fertilizer so as to increase his crop farming production. This will increase his sales, hence earn him more income to enable him to pay for the renovation expenses of his family house.

He is happy with Kiva and its lenders and, promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and fertilizer to increase crop production for increased income to pay for the renovation expenses of his family house.

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en:
Apolinario is 66 years old and is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Apolinario raises pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years. Apolinario requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

 In the future, Apolinario would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jose Lisar

texts.es:
JOSE LISAR TIENE 50 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVIENTE, VIVE CON SU CÓNYUGUE E HIJOS, EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD PEQUEÑA EN LA ZONA RURAL DEL ANEXO COLLIQUE ALTO, EN EL DISTRITO DE PUCALÁ QUE PERTENECE A LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGIÓN LAMBAYEQUE,COSTA NORTE DEL PERÚ.

JOSE LISAR SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES MENORES, DESDE HACE MAS DE 7 MESES DE ANTIGUEDAD, GOZA DE BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES DE PARTE DE SUS VECINOS. ADEMÁS DE LABORES AGRICOLAS EN DIFERENTES CAMPOS DE LA ZONA, Y SOLICITA PRÉSTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE ANIMALES Y ALIMENTO PARA LA CRIANZA DE LOS MISMOS. DE ESTA MANERA HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO, OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA,
texts.en:
Jose Lisar, 50, lives with his common-law wife and children in their own house in a small rural community.  It is located in the Collique Alto Annex in the district of Pucala which belongs to the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru.

Jose Lisar raises and sells small animals and has been in business for seven months.  He has good personal and work references from his neighbors.  He also works in agriculture on different farms in the area.  He is requesting a loan to buy animals and animal feed to raise them.  This will expand his business, give him more income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
NICOLAS TIENE 64 AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERO, VIVE SOLO, EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD GRANDE EN LA ZONA RURAL DEL ANEXO COLLIQUE ALTO, DEL DISTRITO DE PUCALÁ, PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ.

ÉL SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE AGRICULTURA Y LABORES AGRICOLAS EN DIFERENTES CAMPOS DE LA ZONA,Y GOZA DE BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES DE PARTE DE SUS VECINOS. SOLICITA PRÉSTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE FERTILIZANTES PARA SU CULTIVO DE MAIZ. DE ESTA MANERA OBTENER UN MEJOR RENDIMIENTO EN LA COSECHA DE SU CULTIVO DE MAIZ, OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Nicolas, 64, is single and lives alone in his own house in a large rural community in the Collique Alto Annex.  It is located in the district of Pucala, province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru.

Nicolas works in agriculture and related activities on different farms in the area.  He has good personal and work references from his neighbors.  He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for his corn crop to produce a better yield at harvest time.  This will give him more income and improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his corn crop.

loans.name: Cristino Antonio

texts.es:
Cristino, de 32 años de edad, es agricultor, vive junto a su compañera de vida y no tiene hijos aun; estudió hasta noveno grado. 

Cristino, es ganadero en pequeño, tiene 10 años de saber acerca de ese tipo de trabajo que ahora realiza para mantener a su familia.

Cristino, necesita el préstamo para gastos de medicamentos para su padre, porque está mal de salud.

El sueño de Cristino, es ver recuperado a su padre, para darle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristino, 32, lives with his life partner and they have no children yet.  He has a ninth grade education and is a small farmer who has earned a living this way for ten years.

He is in need of a loan to pay for medical expenses for his father who is in ill health.  Cristino's dream is to see his father recover his health so he can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To pay for medical expenses for his father who is ill.

loans.name: Luis Gustavo

texts.es:
Luis Gustavo tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hija de 3 años, en casa familiar en el Sector de Popan bajo en el distrito de Zaña, Provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, costa Norte del Perú. Es una zona rural donde la vida es muy tranquila y armoniosa,las actividades principales en esta comunidad son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Luis se dedica a la actividad de servicios agrícolas, brinda los servicios de arado y surcado en los predios agrícolas de la zona de Popan y sus zonas anexas. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. El presente crédito sera utilizado como capital de trabajo para la compra de animales menores para su crianza, engorde y posterior venta. Esto le permitirá tener ingresos adicionales, mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Gustavo, 23, lives with his wife and three-year-old daughter in the Popan Bajo sector of the Zaña district.  It is in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  It is a rural community where life is very peaceful and harmonious.  The main activities here are agriculture, livestock farming and commerce.

Luis works in agricultural services and provides ploughing services to farms in Popan and neighboring areas.  He has good personal and work references in the district.

The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital to buy small animals to raise and sell.  This will give him extra income and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy small animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es enfermera en el centro de salud de una comunidad cercana  a su domicilio. Ella recorre más de dos horas para llegar a su centro de trabajo, además tambien se  dedica al cultivo de café junto a sus padres con quienes vive. 
En la comunidad donde ella reside no hay acceso al servicio de energía eléctrica por lo cual ella está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de un sistema de energía solar y de esa manera gozar de una mejor calidad de vida al lado de sus padres quienes son personas muy trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Doris works as a nurse at the health center in a neighboring community.  It takes her more than two hours to get to work.  She also grows coffee with her parents and lives with them.

There is no electricity in the community where she lives so she is requesting a loan to buy a solar energy system.  This will give her parents, who are very hard workers, a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system to benefit the family.

loans.name: Anyar Sari 1 Group

texts.en:
One month before the due date, MUK’s staff had informed the Anyar Sari 1 group to prepare their payment. The member of Anyar Sari 1 group already sold their pigs after keeping them for 5 months. The payment collected by the boards of the group and then they come to the meeting to give the money to the staff of MUK. In the meeting they shared their experiences during maintains the pigs. Most of them succes with their business.
Ni Wayan has 4 pigs and she had sold 3 of them for 5.000.000 IDR. The weight for each pig around 90 kg. She made the payment to MUK for 3.500.000 IDR and she spend the rest of the money to fullfill her family needs, especially to support her children education. She has 2 children, first children is in Junior High School and the second children is still in Elementary School. Her husband works as a farmer in his own land.

To continue their business and increasing the population of pig, the Anyar Sari 1 group agree to continue the loan with the same loan size and the same member. Because of Ni Wayan still has 1 pig, she’s use her loan to purchase 2 superior piglets, feed, vitamins and renovate the cage. Now she plan to raise the pig for a sow. She’s prepare 1 piglets to become a sow. She hopes she choose the right pig and she can sell piglets to other breeder in her village.

loans.use: to purchase 2 superior piglets, feed, vitamins and renovate the cage

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Sreypov is a 39-year-old married mother of three children who lives in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She earns her main income from the business of selling food in front of a factory and she has had the business since 2000. Her husband is a 60-year-old doctor, one of her three children is a construction worker, one is a factory worker and the youngest one is in school. The family can earn around USD31 each day. 

Due to the fact that the factory where her child works in is far from home, therefore she would like a loan to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work. With the loan, Sreypov will be able to afford a motorcycle and improve her child’s traveling conditions to earn income to help support the family. In the future, she wants to run a food store and build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work

loans.name: Anyar Sari 2 Group

texts.en:
After running several loans cycles, the Anyar Sari 2 group pay off their loan on time. Still with fattening and pig barbeque programs, they enjoyed to borrow a loan from MUK. It’s because they can form into a group, got trained and the loan need no collateral from the borrower. But, they very responsible for the loan.
Ni Made, as the head of the group, sold her 3 pigs after managing them for 5 months. Ni Made was really happy for the result. The profit is use to make payment and also saving.

Ni Made and the member of Anyar Sari 2 group really thankful because they still get trust to received the loans. They gets the same loan size with 8 members. The loan is use to increase the pig business.
Now she has a sow. The loan received use to purchase superior feed and renovate the cage. Soon the sow will have many piglets and she hopes the piglets can grow fast and she plans to sell them after 2 months.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed for their pigs and renovate the cage

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao is a 52-year-old widow mother of two children, living in Prey Veng province. Nowadays, she grows rice and sells clothes as the main sources of her family’s income for more than five years. Through these current businesses, she could earn about 50,000KHR daily to support her family’s needs. 

For Mao, this is her second loan cycle and she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income and ability to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, is aged 47, married to a welder and they're blessed with two children. Together with her husband, they own and manages a welding shop in their village for almost 15 years and earns a net income of PHP 15,000 weekly. 

Due to insufficient capital in their business, Cecilia would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to purchase materials and equipments that are needed in her welding shop. She's hoping that their business will continue to become more profitable and improve.

loans.use: To purchase materials and equipments that are needed on her welding shop.

loans.name: Pheang's Group

texts.en:
Pheang is a 62-year-old mother of six children and only one of them is dependent child, living in Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. For living, she weaves scarves for sale to support her family and selling grocery items is the additional source of her family’s income.  She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 55,000KHR per day and remains around 25,000KHR daily for emergency needed.

 For Pheang, this is her first loan cycle with VisionFund and she will use her loan portion to buy more grocery items for resale and buy cotton thread to support her weaving scarf business. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income and ability to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Goodhin Group

texts.en: Thoumma’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Thoumma and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Thoumma and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Thoumma’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mamadrizo

texts.en:
Mamadrizo is a purposeful person. He is 57 years old. He lives with his wife and four children in the district of Hamadoni. Mamadrizo is a very good driver, always observe the traffic regulations. He speaks politely with his customers. 

At the moment, his car needs repair and he is unable to feed his family. Mamadrizo wants to buy the spare parts for his car and repair it. He does not have enough money. He hopes that with your generosity and support, he will be able to work better, and provide his family.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts for his car and  repair it

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase toasted breads and sweet breads to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more spices to sell

loans.name: Raghad

texts.en: Raghad lives in Zarqaa with her family, she is a university student majoring art teaching, her father is facing a financial problem the prevent him from paying for Raghad`s university fees, that's why she applied for a loan to become able to cover her tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay for her next semester fees at the university where she is majoring in Art Teaching

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 43 years old and married with one child.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Rowena has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from selling ready to wear.

Rowena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rolyn

texts.en:
Rolyn is 37 years old and married with four children.

Rolyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Rolyn has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Rolyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pakhrad

texts.en:
Pakhrad is 54 years old married man, from village Nazarlo. He has pensioner parents, 2 sons, 2 daughter-in-laws and wife. His income, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of this large family. With the help of his family members Pakhrad is extensively engaged in agribusiness, which is the most important source of his family's income. For more than 15 years, Pakhrad has been involved in cultivation of greens. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Pakhrad wants to start additional business in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of his family. 

A loan of 5000 GEL will be a great support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling him to purchase wedding dresses and hire out it among local people.
This credit will be a great support for the family. Pakhrad is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate more income. The family members rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: To hire out wedding dresses

loans.name: Qusai

texts.en:
Qusai is a 23 year old single man living in Irbid. 
He is studying to get his bachelor degree in physical education, and he is now in his third year. He is from family that consists from five members.

 Because of the financial crises that his family is facing, Qusai applied for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees. Qusai`s future plan is to work in the same field, and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: To help him cover his semester fees in physical education

loans.name: Ramil Mark

texts.en: Ramil Mark is a 21-year old college graduate who lives in Silay City. He belongs to a family of 5. His father is deceased and his mother is a meat vendor. He has 2 siblings. Ramil Mark is the second of three children. His older sister is married and the younger is in elementary. Their total monthy family income of Php 12,000 ($269) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This motivates Ramil Mark to find means to supplement the family income.  Apart from helping his family, Ramil Mark also dreams to become a call center agent. Your help in funding his loan will help Ramil Mark achieve his ambition.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Chehab

texts.en:
Chehab is a 55-year-old married father of two children and a Palestinian refugee. Five years ago, he opened a grocery shop to cover his family's needs and expenses. He is well known and has a good reputation among his region.
Chehab is trying desperately to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise with new items and products to satisfy his customers' needs in the holy month Ramadan.
Chehab hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with new items and products for the holy month Ramadan

loans.name: Kathleen

texts.en: To have additional source of income, Kathleen has been engages in hog-raising business within their community. She is 37 years old, married and has four children attending school. Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, she aimed to further improve the business in order to generate a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional of PHP15,000.00 to buy hog feeds needed in hog-raising. Through hard work and strong determination, Kathleen believes that someday, she will improve more of her business and generates a higher income.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds needed in hog-raising

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell spices. Edna is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy more vegetable like carrot, etc. to sell in the market for her vegetable vending business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable like carrot, etc. to sell in the market

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 67 years old and widowed with five children.  

Florentina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Florentina requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Florentina has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Florentina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elsa is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Elsa has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional firewood to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 53 years old and married with ten children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, bread, condiments, and other groceries.

Elena has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, bread, condiments, and other groceries

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam lives in southern of Jordan, 21 years old single lady lives with her family that consists from 10 members which means that Maryam is a member of big family. 
She is second year in university majoring special breeding, chose this major for ease of finding job in this field. She hopes to complete advanced studies and find a good work to help her family and help her siblings in their education.
Her father is retired from the army and her mom does not work, and with high standard of living; the income become not enough to cover the household and education expense, because of that Maryam applied for an education loan to pay the university fees and she is waiting your support.

loans.use: to pay the university fees in special breeding

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosanna is 56 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rosanna has a fishing net making business in the Philippines. Rosanna requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like nylon threads, etc. for her business.

Rosanna has been in this business for 7 years. Rosanna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like nylon threads, etc. for her fishing net making business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 55 years old and married with five children.

Eugenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, personal product care and other groceries.

Eugenia has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Eugenia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria works hard to support his family. Asteria is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Asteria requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Asteria has been in this business for 15 years now.

Asteria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 60 years old and has three children.

Francisca is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Francisca requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Francisca has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Francisca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rea Ann

texts.en: Rea Ann is a 22-year old college graduate who lives in Silay City. She belongs to a family of 5. Her father works as mechanic and her mother has a home-based business (direct selling). She has 2 siblings; her eldest brother works in a local food shop in Silay and her youngest sister is in elementary school. Their family's monthly income  isPhp 14,000 ($314). This motivates Rea Ann to find means to help her family have more income that’s why she braved  the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Rea Ann wants to improve her English, help her family, develop her self confidence, and have a high paying job. Your support in funding Rea’s Ann loan will help her have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
For almost 15 years now, Leonida runs a sari-sari(variety) store, selling various items such as, beverages, sugar, powdered milk, pouch vinegar, condiments, and toiletries.  She is 55 year old with 3 grown dependents.
She decided to avail the loan to finance her existing business. 

She has requested a loan to  purchase canned goods, soft drinks and soap. These cause to attract more buyers to come and able maintain the variety of goods in her store as well. With these, Leonida's income will augment and able to balance her finances. With these, she could now start to expand and able to settle other possible business opportunities.

Leonida hopes that she could be able to venture food business as additional source of income for the family to be sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft drinks and soap

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 63 years old and widowed with one child.

Janet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, etc..

Janet has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from buy and sell coconut wine.

Janet aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, etc.

loans.name: Songhong Group

texts.en: Pea understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Pea knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Pea purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Pea is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.  Children are photographed with their parents or guardians who were filter purchasers.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 25-year-old university student. He is a third-year student studying chemistry. He lives in Baqaa, and his father is retired. 

Khaled is working hard and always spends his free time working in a part time work in one of the private universities. He would like to request a loan because he does not have enough finances to pay for his university fees. This loan will help him graduate successfully and he will use it to pay for the university. After graduation, Khaled hopes to have a proper job and then he will be able to save enough money to help his family.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees for the third year of chemistry

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a married man with five children. He is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alejandra is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Alejandra has a direct selling avon products business in the Philippines. Alejandra requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products from avon like lipsticks, lotion, shampoo, etc. to sell to her customers.

Alejandra has been in this business for 15 years. Alejandra would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon like lipsticks, lotion, shampoo, etc. to sell to her customers

loans.name: Napoed Group

texts.en: Bounkhong understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Bounkhong knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Bounkhong purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Bounkhong is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Vanneth

texts.en:
Vanneth, 32 years old, is living in a community of Kandal Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of three children. She is a dessert seller and earns, on average, an earning of USD 5.00 a day. So far, she has been in this type of business for two years. 

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 24 years, married to Judy old and he supports 2 children. 

He has been in a motorcycle transport services business for the last 1 year and the business earns him KES 9,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase spare parts such as tyres, wheel boosters and windscreens so as to offer better and faster transport to clients and meet both client and family needs. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable and purchase more motorcycles to do transport services.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as tyres, wheel boosters and windscreens so as to offer better and faster transport to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of grain cereals for sale to clients and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs for better production

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married man with two children. He is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lowie is 17 years old and is 5th of five children in the family. 


He is enrolling in a bachelor of science in community development course.

Her mother Lydia is borrowing 4217 loan through NWTF to fully pay the tuition fees of the 4 years skills training.

When she graduates, Lowie plans to graduate and be gainfully employed

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son's  B.Sc course

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is 39 years of age, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 so as to benefit from the enterprise development training. 

She operates a green grocer store where she sells assorted fruits and vegetables e.g Kales, Potatoes, Cabbages and Bananas. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more fruits and vegetables so as to add stock to her grocery shop for increased income to enable her pay for better education and health services for her family.

Teresiah is happy and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support which will enable her expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables so as to add stock to her green grocer store for increased income to pay for better education and health services for her family.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina works hard to support her family. Avelina is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Avelina requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Avelina has been in this business for 6 years now.

Avelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Jane; she is 37 years old, married and blessed with four children.
She joined hand in hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and she learnt more skills on enterprise development and financial management. Jane has been doing dairy farming for the past 3 years. 

After the training she started a honey selling business to supplement her income. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more honey for sale since demand for honey has gone high and also wants to increase her income in order to continue supporting her family by providing basic needs with ease. 
 Jane appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of honey that will help supplement incomeand thus cater for family needs with ease.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk produced supplied to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of goods and products such as cooking flour, baking flour for sale to clients and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stocks of goods and products such as cooking oil for sale to clients and meet both client and family need.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fridge for soft drinks supplies in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 42 years old and married with four children. Carmelita works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like beverages, canned goods, noodles, etc..
