Carmelita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, noodles, eggs, oil and other groceries. 

In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like beverages, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 55 years old and married with three children.

Amelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Amelita has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the raising pigs for 3 years and also earns an income from general store.

Amelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 51 years old and married with five children.  

Meriam is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Meriam requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Meriam has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Meriam would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analyn is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Analyn has a processed food making business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Analyn  has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Analyn  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 44 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Salvacion works very hard to provide for them.

Salvacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Salvacion has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft-drinks, cooking oil, noodles, candies, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of coffee, beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Erika. She is 31 years old, married and blessed with one child who is school going. She does farming of maize, beans and potatoes to earn her living. The training on enterprise management and financial management has enabled her gain more skills and knowledge on business management. She is borrowing a loan from kiva to purchase farm inputs e.g. fertilizers. She plans to use profit generated from enterprise to cater for her children education and plough back the rest to her business.

Erika is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer to help improve farming thus more income to cater for education.

loans.name: Diana Margarita

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Eloy Alfaro De Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en las afueras del cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayor actividad de los habitantes es la pesca y el turismo ya que existen lugares paradisiacos que son visitados por muchos turistas.
En este lugar vive la señora Diana, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad, el mayor  estudia en escuela. Su marido  se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Diana es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante,  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale ya sea en las mañanas o noches a ofrecer sus productos, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva  más de 1 año  con esta actividad  la cual le ayuda a salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y otras prendas. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The Elfoy Alfaro de Jaramijo communal loan group meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its lovely beaches. The inhabitants' primary work is fishing and tourism since there are idyllic places that are visited by many tourists.

Diana lives in this place. She is 24 years old, married, and in this relationship they have two children, ages 6 and 3. The older one is a student. Her husband works fishing.

Diana is a woman who likes to work to help her husband get ahead. She works selling all sorts of clothing. She sells from door to door, she goes out at morning or night to offer her products. She leaves them on credit and collects weekly, and she has done this work for more than one year, which helps her to get ahead.

This loan is to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, and other clothing. She has been in the loan group for 4 loan cycles and she likes it for the help that the loans bring. Her dream is to give her little ones the best.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, and other clothing.

loans.name: Johanna Katherine

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Eloy Alfaro De Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en las afueras del cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayor actividad de los habitantes es la pesca y el turismo ya que existen lugares paradisiacos que son visitados por muchos turistas.
En este lugar vive la señora Johanna, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos de 15, 12, 9, 8  y 1 año de edad, actualmente está en su octavo mes de embarazo de su sexto hijo, dos de sus hijos estudian en  escuela. El marido  se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Johanna es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo tenga los recursos necesarios para poder realizar un gran trabajo, su esposo se dedica a la pesca, el junto a otra persona se van a alta mar  en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca, ellos salen en la mañana y regresan a la tarde y en ocasiones hasta el otro día con los productos que le mar les da, una vez en la playa entregan los productos a comerciantes mayoristas para que estos los distribuyan a toda la provincia.
Este crédito es para  comprar redes, piolas y combustibles. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y los créditos adicionales que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener un gran barco para que su esposo realice sus faenas de pesca.
texts.en:
The Elfoy Alfaro de Jaramijo communal loan group meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its lovely beaches. The inhabitants' primary work is fishing and tourism since there are idyllic places that are visited by many tourists.

Johanna lives in this place. She is 36 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has 5 children, ages 15, 12, 9, 8 and 1. Currently, she is eight months pregnant with her sixth child. Two of her children go to school. Her husband works in fishing.

Johanna is a good housewife who takes out the loan so that her husband has the resources he needs to be able to do good work. Her husband works in fishing; with another person, he goes out to sea in his small boat to do the fishing tasks. They leave in the morning and come back in the afternoon, and sometimes the next day, with the products that the sea gives them. Once at the beach, they turn their products over to the wholesalers so that they can be sold throughout the whole province.

This loan is to purchase nets, line, and fuel. She has been in the communal loan group for 2 years and she likes it because of the help and the additional loans that the institution offers. Her dream is to have a larger boat for her husband to use for fishing.

loans.use: to purchase nets, line, and fuel.

loans.name: Francisco Saturnino

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Eloy Alfaro De Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en las afueras del cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayor actividad de los habitantes es la pesca y el turismo ya que existen lugares paradisiacos que son visitados por muchos turistas.
En este lugar vive don Francisco, tiene 51 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su mujer es ama de casa.
Don Francisco es un hombre muy trabajador que realiza cualquier actividad para darles lo mejor a su familia, el en temporadas se dedica a la pesa y también realiza fletes en una moto taxi que tiene, en este lugar ese es el medio de transporte más utilizado por las personas, trabaja todos los días y los fines de semanas son los días que mejores ganancias le dejan ya que llegan turistas y ellos utilizan este medio para que los lleve de paseo a lugares más alejados de la ciudad,  lleva más de 5 años ofreciendo este servicio lo cual le ha permitido salir adelante.
Este crédito lo espera utilizar para realizar ciertos arreglos en su moto y así brindar un mejor servicio.  Lleva 4 ciclos en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del grupo. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Elfoy Alfaro de Jaramijo communal loan group meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its lovely beaches. The inhabitants' primary work is fishing and tourism since there are idyllic places that are visited by many tourists.

Francisco lives in this place. He is 51 years old, and in a common-law marriage in which he has two children, ages 5 and 3. The older one goes to school. His wife is a housewife.

Francisco is a very hard-working man who does whatever job to give his family the best. In season, he works fishing, and he also provides transportation in a motorcycle taxi that he has. In this place, this is the most commonly used mode of transportation by the people. He works every day and the weekends are the days with the greatest earnings since the tourists arrive and they use this mode to bring them on tours to places farther from the city. He has been offering this service for more than 5 years, which has allowed him to get ahead.

He hopes to use this loan to do some repairs on his motorcycle and, so, to offer better service. He has been in the communal loan group for 4 cycles and he likes it for the help that he gets from the group. His dream is to give his family the best.

loans.use: to do repairs on his motorcycle.

loans.name: Yojana Alexandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Eloy Alfaro De Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en las afueras del cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayor actividad de los habitantes es la pesca y el turismo ya que existen lugares paradisiacos que son visitados por muchos turistas.
En este lugar vive la señora Yojana, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos de 19, 15, 5  y 3 años de edad, dos  estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido  se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Yojana se dedica a la venta de alimentos en su casa, todas las tardes prepara pollos asados, los mismos que acompaña con patacones o chifles y ensalada lo cual es de mucho agrado de sus clientes, ella solo entrega los alimentos ya que aun no cuenta con un local con mesas, ella espera en un futuro adecuar un local y así vender mucho más, lleva más de 3 años con su negocio el cual le permite ganar lo suyo y así salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pollos, plátanos y otros víveres que utiliza para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos se ayudan para salir adelante. Sus sueños se darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Elfoy Alfaro de Jaramijo communal loan group meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its lovely beaches. The inhabitants' primary work is fishing and tourism since there are idyllic places that are visited by many tourists.

Yojana lives in this place. She is 37 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has 4 children, ages 19, 15, 5, and 3. Two are students, in primary and secondary school. Her husband works fishing.

Yojana works selling food in her house. Every afternoon she prepares roasted chicken, which she accompanies with fried plantain or fried plantain with sweet sauce and salad, which is much to her customers' liking. She only delivers the food since she still doesn't have a retail space with tables. She hopes in the future to outfit a space and in this way sell a lot more. She has had her business for more than 3 years, which allows her to earn her own income and, so, to get ahead. 

This loan will be used to purchase chickens, plantains, and other groceries which she will use to prepare her foods. She has been in the communal loan group since the beginning and she likes it because, with the loans, they help each other to get ahead. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, plantains and other groceries.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been in the pig raising business for more than 20 years. She is a married woman with five grown children from Talibon, Bohol, in the Philippines. In addition to that, she also runs a bakery, selling bread, pastries and many other baked goods. 

Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy piglets, as well as bakery supplies such as flour, sugar and coconut. These purchases will surely improve her livelihood. Thus, she will be able to raise healthy hogs and also have the necessary ingredients for bread production. Elizabeth's income will grow and she will be able to start expanding her current businesses. 

Elizabeth is determined to manage both her businesses successfully so she can renovate her house and also to support the education of her grandchildren for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and bakery supplies

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 39 ans, Afi est une femme mariée qui habite à Baguida. Pour exercer son activité, Afi vend des charbons de bois et trouve son gain favorable. Afi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois, Afi nécessite ce prêt pour financer sa commande et réaliser plus de gains pour l’épanouissement de son foyer.
texts.en: Afi is 39 years old, married, and lives in Baguida. Afi earns a living from selling wood charcoal and is able to make a good profit from this. She gets her supplies twice monthly from the market. Afi needs this loan in order to purchase more bags of wood charcoal. This will allow her to earn greater profits and thereby improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase nine bags of wood charcoal

loans.name: Alina

texts.fr: Alina est une femme divorcée âgée de 38 ans. Alina vit à Tokoin avec un enfant. Pour trouver son revenu, Alina vend des articles de mercerie dans son quartier afin de soutenir sa famille dans les besoins quotidiens. Alina  s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Alina demande ce financement pour commander rouleaux de tissus et des cartons de fils pour faire plus de bénéfice afin d’être efficacement utile dans l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en: Alina is a 38-year-old divorcee. She lives in Tokoin with one child. To earn a living, Alina sells dry goods in her local area in order to support her family with their daily needs. She gets her supplies twice monthly from market. Alina is requesting this loan to purchase rolls of fabric and boxes of yarn so she can earn a greater profit, thereby helping her family to flourish.

loans.use: to purchase 16 rolls of fabric and one box of yarn

loans.name: Pabla Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Eloy Alfaro De Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en las afueras del cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayor actividad de los habitantes es la pesca y el turismo ya que existen lugares paradisiacos que son visitados por muchos turistas.
En este lugar vive la señora Pabla, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 3 hijos de 19, 13 y 9 años de edad, los  dos menores estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido  es mecánico y  pintor.
Doña Pabla es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para contribuir con los gastos que demandan la educación de sus hijos y los del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, tiene un local en la casa de sus padres donde vende bebidas como gaseosas, aguas, cervezas, bocadillos de picar, empanadas de verde, corviches entre otros. Son muchas las personas que llegan hasta su local a conversar y distraerse un rato y probar lo que ella prepara, los días que más vende son los fines de semana ya que es cuando más turistas hay en la ciudad, lleva más de 10 años con esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario.
Este crédito es para comprar aguas, colas, cervezas y bocadillos que ella vende. Lleva 5 ciclos en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella se ayuda mucho. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Elfoy Alfaro de Jaramijo communal loan group meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its lovely beaches. The inhabitants' primary work is fishing and tourism since there are idyllic places that are visited by many tourists.

Pabla lives in this place. She is 32 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has 3 children, ages 19, 13, and 9. The two younger ones are students, in primary and secondary school. Her husband is a mechanic and painter.

Pabla is a woman who likes to work to contribute to the educational expenses of her children, and those of the household. She works in business, she has a place in her parents' house where she sells drinks such as soft drinks, water, beer and snacks, green empanadas, corviche, and more. Many people come to her place to talk and distract themselves a bit, and to taste what she has prepared. The days she sells the most are the weekends since that is when there are the most tourists in the city. She has done this work for more than 10 years, which allows her to earn daily sustenance. 

This loan is to purchase water, soft drinks, beer, and snacks that she sells. She has been in the communal loan group for 5 loan cycles and she likes it because, with the loan, she is helping her self a lot. Her dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase water, soft drinks, beer and snacks.

loans.name: Carmen Maclovia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Eloy Alfaro De Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en las afueras del cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayor actividad de los habitantes es la pesca y el turismo ya que existen lugares paradisiacos que son visitados por muchos turistas.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene siete hijos, cuatro mayores de edad y tres de 17, 15 y 12 años, los dos menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Carmen es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para contribuir con los gastos que demandan la educación de sus hijos y los del hogar, ella  desde hace tres años se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal, Avon, (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa. Ella también le da a su marida parte del crédito para que él lo utilice en sus faenas de pesca, de esta forma ellos salen adelante trabajando en conjunto por el bien familiar. 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, productos naturales y materiales de pesca que el marido necesita. Esta desde el inicio en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Elfoy Alfaro de Jaramijo communal loan group meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its lovely beaches. The inhabitants' primary work is fishing and tourism since there are idyllic places that are visited by many tourists.

Carmen lives in this place. She is 46 years old, married, and in this relationship has seven children, four of whom are adults and three are ages 17, 15, and 12. The two younger one are students in secondary and primary school. Her husband works in fishing. 

Carmen is a woman who likes to work to contribute to her children's educational expenses and those of the household. For the past three years, she has worked in sales, selling Yanbal and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories). She sells from door to door and also sells in her house. She also will give part of the loan to her husband so that he will use it in his fishing tasks. In this way, they get ahead working together for the good of the family. 

This loan is to purchase perfumes, creams, natural products, and fishing materials that her husband needs. She has been in the loan group since the beginning and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she finances her business. Her dream is to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, natural products, and fishing materials.

loans.name: Jonathan Damian

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Eloy Alfaro De Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en las afueras del cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayor actividad de los habitantes es la pesca y el turismo ya que existen lugares paradisiacos que son visitados por muchos turistas.
En este lugar vive el señor Jonathan, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de los padres. El lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le sirven para mejorar su negocio.
Don Jonathan con sus padres tienen un deposito en cual distribuyen colas, aguas en bidón y en botellas pequeñas, son  muchas las personas que les compran en su local y también  entrega a domicilio con lo cual se gana algo extra, este negocio lo tienen más de 7 años, negocio que les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar aguas, colas y jugos y para construir un quiosco en el cual puedan vender mejor sus productos. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Elfoy Alfaro de Jaramijo communal loan group meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its lovely beaches. The inhabitants' primary work is fishing and tourism since there are idyllic places that are visited by many tourists.

Jonathan lives in this place. He is 19 years old, single, and lives in his parents' house. He has been in the loan group for 2 loan cycles and he likes it because the loans help him to improve his business.

Jonathan, with his parents, has a small store where they sell soft drinks and water in jugs and small bottles. Many people make purchases in their shop and also they make home deliveries with which they earn a bit extra. They have had this business for more than 7 years, a business which allows them to get ahead.

This loan is to purchase water, soft drinks, and juices and to build a kiosk where they can sell their products better. His dream is to have a large retail space.

loans.use: to purchase water, soft drinks and juices and build a kiosk.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines.

Erlinda has requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business, which she has been in for seven years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her icecream business

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
Erlina is 28 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Erlina requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Erlina would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified seeds for planting toe earn more income

loans.name: Nexi Yesenia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Eloy Alfaro De Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en las afueras del cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayor actividad de los habitantes es la pesca y el turismo ya que existen lugares paradisiacos que son visitados por muchos turistas.
En este lugar vive la señora Nexi, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 20 y 18 años que estudian en universidad. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Nexi es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y con esto contribuir con los gastos que demandan la educación de sus hijos y los del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa, ella sale a recorrer en las mañanas o en las tardes, deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo para el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva más de 4 ciclos en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son que  sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The credit group Eloy Alfaro de Jaramijo meets every 15 days in the outskirts of Jaramijó Canton. This area is known for its beautiful beaches. The main occupations of its inhabitants are fishing and tourism, due to the idyllic locations that exist there, which are visited by many tourists.

This is where Nexi lives. She is 38 years old, is married and has two children with her partner. They are 20 and 18 years old and studying at university. Her husband is a chauffeur.

Nexi is a woman who likes to make her own earnings and with these, she contributes to the expenses of her children’s education and of the household. She works in the commercial sector selling Yanbal products (women’s beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories).

Nexi conducts her sales door-to-door as well as in her home, going out on her rounds in the morning or afternoon, puts her products on credit and gets paid every eight or fifteen days. She has worked in this business for eight years, earning her part for the good of her family.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics. Nexi has been with the credit group for four loan cycles and she enjoys it because thanks to these loans, she has been able to get ahead. Her dream is that her children will become professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: José Rodrigo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Eloy Alfaro De Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en las afueras del cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayor actividad de los habitantes es la pesca y el turismo ya que existen lugares paradisiacos que son visitados por muchos turistas.
En este lugar vive don José, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 8, 6 y 4 años de edad, los dos  mayores estudian en escuela. Su mujer es comerciante.
El señor José es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta a base de trabajo sacar adelante a su familia, él junto a su mujer tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otros víveres. El también tiene una embarcación pequeña en la cual junto a otras personas salen a pescar tres a cuatro días por semana, en estos días es su mujer la que se queda en la tienda pero cuando él está en casa son los dos que trabajan juntos, de esta forma se ganan la vida, son más de 10 años que llevan en este negocio.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar víveres y materiales de pesca. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque con los  créditos mejora su negocio. Sus metas son seguir aumentando su tienda cada día más.
texts.en:
The Elfoy Alfaro de Jaramijo communal loan group meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its lovely beaches. The inhabitants' primary work is fishing and tourism since there are idyllic places that are visited by many tourists.

José lives in this place. He is 34 years old and in a common-law marriage from which he has three children, ages 8, 6, and 4. The two older ones go to school. His wife is a businesswoman.

José is a very hard-working man who likes to get his family ahead with his work. With his wife, they have a grocery store in their house. There, they sell all sorts of basic products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other groceries. He also has a small boat in which he goes out to fish three or four days per week with other people. On those days, his wife is the one who stays in the store, but when he is home, the two work together. In this way they earn their living. They have had this business for more than 10 years. 

This loan will be used to stock their store more. He will purchase groceries and fishing materials. He has been in the loan group for 3 loan cycles and he likes it because, with the loans, he improves his business. His goal is to continue expanding his store every day.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and fishing materials.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
WILMER TIENE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERO, SIN HIJOS, VIVE EN CASA DE SUS PADRES EN EL CASERIO DE HUAYOPAMPA DISTRITO DE SALLIQUE,EN LA PROVINCIA DE JAEN, REGIÓN CAJAMARCA, SIERRA NORTE DEL PERÚ, ES UN CASERIO MEDIANO, LA POBLACION SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO LA AGRICULTURA Y LA GANADERIA.

ÉL SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA, CUENTA CON UNA FINCA DE LIMA FRUTERA,COSECHA DE MANERA MENSUAL DICHOS PRODUCTOS LO VENDE A LOS COMERCIENTES DE LUGAR QUE LUEGO LO LLEVAN AL MERCADO DE CHICLAYO, ADEMAS SE DESEMPEÑA COMO PEON AGRICOLA EN SU CASERIO Y CASERIOS CERCANOS, CLIENTE PRESENTA BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES. EL DESTINO DEL PRESTAMO ES LA INVERSION EN SU NEGOCIO, COMPRANDO FERTILIZANTES, ABONOS ENTRE OTROS, CON LA FINALIDAD DE INCREMENTAR SUS VENTAS Y ASI OBTENER MAYORES INGRESOS, PARA QUE MEJORE SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 24 years old, single, with no children. He lives in his parents' house in the village of Huayopampa, in Sallique district, Jaen province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. It is a medium-sized village. The population works in trade, agriculture, and animal husbandry. 

He works in agriculture. He has a lime farm. He harvests monthly and sells these products to business people in the place who later bring them to the Chiclayo market. In addition, he works as a farm laborer in his village and nearby villages. His customers give him good personal and work references. The loan will be used to invest in his business, purchasing fertilizer, manure, and more, with the end of increasing his sales and, so, getting more income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in his business, buying fertilizers, manure and more.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Una sonrisa amorosa de María, da la bienvenida a su tienda de mercadería variada.  Con más de veinte años de experiencia, esta emprendedora de 54 años de edad, se siente más que feliz trabajando como comerciante, pues siempre quiso poseer un trabajo propio que tanto le apasionara, que incrementara los ingresos de su hogar y ayudara a proveer la educación de sus tres hijos. Ahora son sus hijos quienes le apoyan con su negocio.
Esta comerciante empezó vendiendo rosquillas de manera ambulante y ahora tiene su propio establecimiento con una venta variada. La felicidad se acopia de ella y la hace sentirse orgullo de su progreso, el cual considera debe seguir creciendo. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar vestidos, juguetes, pañales, camisas, pantalones, entre otros productos que son solicitados todos los días. De manera que mantendrá surtido sus productos y podrá ahorrar para comprar la vitrina que necesita. María también sueña con hacer crecer más su negocio y ser conocida en ferias.
texts.en:
María's loving smile welcomes all to her store which sells a variety of merchandise. With over twenty years of experience, this enterprising 54-year-old feels more than happy to work as a shopkeeper, as she always wanted to have a job that she could be excited about, and one which would increase her household income and help provide for an education to her three children. Now it's her children who support her with the business.

This shopkeeper started as a street vendor selling donuts and now has her own shop with a wide variety of merchandise. She has found happiness with her store and is proud to see its progress, which she believes should continue to grow. For this reason, she asks for a loan to buy clothes, toys, diapers, shirts, pants, and other products that are requested daily. This way she'll keep her products stocked and will be able to save to buy the showcase she needs. María also dreams of making her business grow and being well-known at fairs.

loans.use: to buy clothes, toys, diapers, shirts, pants, among other products

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 64 years old and married with three children, who she works very hard to provide for.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, such as condiments, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Erlinda has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, vinegar, soy sauce, toiletries and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her general store

loans.name: Teriki

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Teriki. She is 67 years old, married, and blessed with six children. She also lives with her two grandchildren. Teriki joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from courses on enterprise development and financial management. This improved her knowledge in business management. She has been able to advance her dairy farming through proper business recording and prudent management. 

Teriki is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy meal that will help boost milk yield and thus improve her income, which will help her meet her family's needs such as food and clothing with ease. Teriki appreciates Kiva for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy meal that will help boost milk production and thus improve her income which will help her meet her family's needs with ease.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 45 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and has been running the business for six years. She also earns income from selling dried fish.

Marietta requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. Marietta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jose Heliodoro

texts.es:
José es un artesano talabartero de 61 años de edad, un hombre experimentando que sabe muy bien desarrollar su actividad, fabrica toda clase de artículos para la equitación, ver trabajar a este hombre es todo un arte, a que no necesita de una maquina todo lo hace mano.

Este negocio le ha servido a José para mantener y alimentar una numerosa familia conformada por nada más y nada menso que 8 hijos, que junto a él y su esposa forman 10 personas que comen 4 o 5 veces al día.

Su propósito en la vida es trabajar, tener un negocio fuerte y estable el cual pueda ceder a alguno de sus hijos, luchar por un mejor futuro para su familia, mantener a los más pequeños estudiando y mantener viva la tradición de talabarteros artesanales en la región.

José quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para seguir desarrollando su actividad (ver foto un ejemplo de lo que realiza), el cuero de vaca pro denominación y tradición es el principal elemento y en ello quiere gastar todo su dinero, teniendo suficientes insumos para fabricar prendas por un periodo de 3 meses.
texts.en:
José is an artisan saddlemaker, age 61. He is an experienced man who knows very well how to do this work. He makes all sorts of items for horseback riding. To see this man work is an art; he doesn't need a machine, he does everything by hand.  

This business has served José to support and feed his large family made up of no more and no fewer than 8 children who, along with him and his wife, are 10 people who eat 4 or 5 times per day.

His life goal is to work, to have a strong and stable business which he can give to one of his children. He fights for a better future for his family, to support the little ones in school and to keep the artisan saddlemaking tradition alive in the region.

José wants to ask for a loan to purchase raw materials to continue doing his work (see the photo for an example of what he makes). Cow leather, by type and tradition is the principal element and on which he wants to spend all of his money, to have sufficient supplies to make items for a period of 3 months.

loans.use: to purchase cow leather which is the supply with which he does he work.

loans.name: Maria Elsy Del Socorro

texts.es:
María Elcy es un dulce y cariñosa abuelita de 63 años de edad, ella trabaja diariamente para mantener su hogar y a su nieta la cual cuida mientras su hija trabaja, se dedica a la venta de mercancía por encargo y usa los portafolios de revista para mostrar los productos en venta.


Un desafortunado suceso le imposibilito trabajar libremente, dejándola solo con la alternativa de vender mercancía y aunque es lo único que tiene se aferra a al esperanza de vender cada día más para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y darle a su nieta e hija la mejor calidad de vida que este en sus manos y siempre y cuando su salud se lo permita, no quiere sentirse como un estorbo quiere demostrar que es un valioso y útil elemento en el hogar.

Su sueño a sus 63 años de edad es comprar una vivienda propia.

María Elcy solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos principalmente pijamas, lociones y accesorios para mujer que son los productos que más rotación de ventas tienen.
texts.en:
María Elcy is a sweet and loving grandmother, 63 years old. She works daily to support her household and her granddaughter who she watches while her daughter works. She works selling merchandise on commission and uses catalogs to show the products for sale. 

An unfortunate event made it impossible for her to work freely, leaving her with only the alternative of selling merchandise and, although it is the only thing that she has, she holds onto the hope of selling more each day to improve the condition of her house and give her granddaughter and daughter the best quality of life that is at her hands, provided that her health allows it. She doesn't want to feel like a nuisance and wants to show that she is a valuable and useful part of the household. 

Her dream, at 63 years old, is to purchase her own house. 

María Elcy asks for a loan to purchase an assortment of products, primarily pajamas, lotions and women's accessories which are the products with the highest sales.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of products, primarily pajamas, lotions and women's accessories which are the products with the highest sales.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 53 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jesusa has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Jesusa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Merlette

texts.en:
Merlette is 42 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Merlette is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Merlette has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Merlette requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

In the future, Merlette would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of manufactured hair pieces and shampoo for making hair of clients pretty so as to meet client needs.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Estelita is 52 years old now.

Estelita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

Estelita requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. 

In the future, Estelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old and a single mother of four children.
 
She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in March, 2014, and has received training on enterprise management and financial planning. This training has equipped her with skills to effectively manage her enterprise of maize and beans farming.

She requires a loan in order to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds. This will increase her proceeds and therefore boost her income and enable her to pay school fees for her children with ease. 

Jane is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to make established payments.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds that will help boost farming and bring more income to pay for school fees with ease.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 52 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Judith has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Judith has been in this business for three years.

Judith requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Judith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Philbert

texts.en:
Philbert is 35 years old. He is married with 4 children, aged between 2 and 8 years; 3 of them go to school. He owns a shop and has been doing in a business for the past three years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more salt, rice and sugar to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and make savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more salt, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is a 62-year-old married homemaker with four grownup children and lives in a village in the Kandal province in Cambodia. Her husband is 62 years old and works as a construction worker, one of her children is a driver, one works in a coffee shop and another works in the factory. Together, the family earn $24 each day. 

Pheap is now applying for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her child, who is a driver, for commuting to work to earn income to help support the family. This is her second loan with Kiva through Kredit MFI. This loan will help her child have his own motorcycle and improve the mean of traveling. In the future, she is going to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child for commuting to work

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 38 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 2 and 10 years old. They all go to school.  She has farmed for 22 years and will use the kiva loan, to buy fertilizers to grow maize and to sell the maize. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow maize and to sell the maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Claude

texts.en: Claudine is 37 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 3 and 9 years old. Two of them go  school.  He has farmed for 8 years and will use the Kiva loan, to buy a cooling tank for milk for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy a milk cooling tank and sell the milk, to help pay school fees.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is thirty seven years old, married and a father of two children who are currently attending school. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the trainings and especially enterprise development training.  
He operates a general retail shop where he sells commodities like sugar, salt, tea leaves, soap, cooking fat and other household items. He is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more household items hence add stock to his general retail shop for increased income. This will enable him meet his family’s basic needs and pay school fees for his children with ease. 
Joseph is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. He promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of consumables items to his general retail shop for increased income to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en: Ethienne is 53 years old. He is married with 5 children aged between 13 and 24 years old. Three of them go school.  He has farmed for the past 8 years and will use the kiva loan, to buy cooling tank and milk for selling. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and buy food for home consumptions.

loans.use: To buy a milk cooling tank and then sell the milk, to help pay school fees

loans.name: Srey Noeun

texts.en: Living in Kampong Cham province, Srey Noeun is 30 years old and a mother of a small child who is too young to attend school. For her living, she grows cassava and pepper as the main source of her family’s income for ages. Srey Noeun has been with VisionFund for two cycles already and completely paid back her past loans. The previous loans helped her to have a better living condition. By the way, her pepper crops grew not well last years, because of having too much rain, so it effected to her income.  Now she has not enough fund to do farming, so she decides to apply for a new Kiva loan via VisionFund and she will manage her loan to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing and labor fee. She expects her family has enough household supplies and keep sending her children in school until their graduation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava and pepper crops and pay for plowing and labor fees

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita works hard to support his family. Marianita is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Marianita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials and gear for her business.

Marianita has been in this business for 10 years now.

Marianita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela works hard to support her family. Adela is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Adela requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Adela has been in this business for 9 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Adela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica works hard to support her family. Monica is married and has a selling bicycles business in the Philippines.

Monica requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts and bicycles to sell.

Monica has been in this business for 2 years now.

Monica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts and bicycles to sell

loans.name: Mulima

texts.en: Mulima is 63 years old. He is married with 6 children aged between 17 and 30 years, two of them go to school. He has been a farmer for the past 8 years. With the loan Kiva, he would like to buy a milk cooling tank and sell the milk. Profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy a milk cooling tank and then sell the milk, to help with school fees

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elma works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell rice. Elma is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables, can goods, etc for her restaurant business.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Ngechu

texts.en:
The person  in the photo Ngechu. He is forty three years old, married and a father of five children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.
He is a tailor who also sells second hand clothes and has been in this business for the last eight years. Ngechu appreciates Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on record keeping, enterprise development, savings and financial management. He is able to use his business income to provide for his family’s needs such as food, shelter and school fees.

He is borrowing from Kiva to purchase more second hand clothes for sale due to the increased demand from his customers. This will enable him cater for the family needs and school fees with ease.
Ngechu is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of second hand clothes that will help improve sales thus cater for family needs with ease.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Luchador, una persona verraca, echada para adelante, así es Samuel  una persona del campo que trabaja diariamente 8 horas en su campo ordeñando las vacas, buscando mejores condiciones para su hogar, agilizar su producción, luchar por los papeles legales de su tierra y combatir una problemática general de los lecheros que es el bajo precio de venta de la leche debido al aumento de emprendedores que realizan esta actividad.

Samuel es padre de 4 hijos hoy tiene un sueño el cual es enviar a su hija menor de 18 años de edad a la universidad y dejarle el negocio a su familia es un sueño ya a largo plazo, y es un sueño ya que quiere que sigan al tradición de lecheros que nació generación atrás.

Buscando regular sus ingresos y aprovechar mejor sus extensos terrenos Samuel quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una vaca lechera, aumentando su producción con el único objetivo de volver a tener los ingresos que ostentaba años atrás.
texts.en:
Tenacious, an outstanding person, ahead of the game: that’s Samuel, a country person who works eight hours a day in his field milking the cows, working to improve the conditions of his home, accelerating his production, striving to get legal papers for his land and dealing with the low sale prices of milk, a general problem for dairy farmers due to the increased number of entrepreneurs in the business.

Samuel is the father of four children. He now has a dream to send his younger daughter, 18, to university. His long-term goal is to leave his business to his family, and it is his dream because he wants them to follow the tradition of dairy farming that started generations ago.

Seeking to stabilize his income and to better take advantage of his extensive lands, Samuel wishes to request a loan for the purchase of a dairy cow, increasing his productivity with the sole objective of regaining the earnings he boasted years ago.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tounda Wendé Group

texts.fr: Louise ,membre représentatif est marié et mère d'un enfant. Cette jeûne dame fait des chips, des gâteaux et aussi des cacaouettes pour vendre. Louise et son groupe est à son troisième contrat de prêt avec ACFIME, mais jusque là, les remboursements se font sans difficultés. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter des arachides à 20 000 francs, de la farine de blé à 15 000 francs, de la banane plantain à 10 000, de l'huile à 17 500 francs et le reste de son argent servira pour les autres dépenses liées à son activité. Louise à beaucoup de client et pour les maintenir, elle prend leur contact téléphonique, elle va à la recherche de nouveau clients dans les service et elle donne du respect à tout le monde. Après ses ventes, Louise aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer son activité et aussi d'aider son époux à faire les dépenses de leur maison.
texts.en:
Louise, the featured borrower, is married and a mother of one child. This young woman makes chips, cakes, and also peanuts to sell. She and her group are on their third loan with ACFIME, and up until now they have had no problems with their repayments.

Louise needs this loan to buy groundnuts at 20,000 francs, wheat flour at 15,000 francs, plantains at 10,000 francs, and oil at 17,500 francs. She will use the rest of the money to cover other expenses connected to her business.

Louise has many customers and to keep them, she keeps in contact with them by telephone. She is going to look for new customers in the service industry and she respects everyone.

After her sales, Louise will have profits that will allow her to continue her business and also to help her husband with their household's expenses.

loans.use: to buy flour, groundnuts, and plantains

loans.name: Gnetaa Group

texts.fr:
Sèba est celui qui a la main levé sur la phoro.
Sèba est un cultivateur malien dont son activité principal est l’achat de céréale, arachide il est âgé de 40 ans  marié, père de 6 enfants. Il n’a jamais été à l’école. 
Sèba a commencé à acheter les céréales, arachide, petit mil depuis 5 ans. il exerce cette activité, pour bien préparer  l’avenir de ses enfants et avoir la satisfaction dans son activité à hauteur de souhait. Il fait recourt au RMCR pour acheter  beaucoup de sacs de céréales ‘(arachides, petit mil, dah). Le bénéfice trouvé dans les céréales, arachide, petit mil, dah lui permet de gérer certaines charges dans la famille tels que l’habillement des enfants, traitement médical et avoir certains bien tel que les bœufs de labour, moto, un terrain dans la ville pour l’avenir des enfants.
Il s’approvisionne en céréales arachide, petit mil, dah dans le marché de la zone et revend dans le même marché où dans le district.
texts.en:
Sèba is the man with his hand raised in the photo. He is a Malian farmer, who primarily buys and sells cereals and groundnuts. He is 40 years old, married, and the father of six children. Sèba never went to school.

He started buying [and selling] cereals, groundnuts, and millet five years ago. He does this work so as to prepare for his children's future and to have satisfaction in the work that he loves. 

Sèba joined RMCR to buy many bags of cereals (groundnuts, millet, bissap). Earnings from his sales will allow him to manage various family expenses, especially his children's clothing and health needs and to have certain luxuries, such as oxen, a motorcycle, and a piece of land in the village for his children's future.

He procures his cereals of groundnuts, millet, and bissap in the local market and resells them in the same market or in the surrounding area.

loans.use: to buy sacs of cereal to resell

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Minata a le mouton à la main.
Minata est éleveuse malienne âgé de 55ans. Elle exerce cette activité il y a plus de 10 ans. Elle est analphabète ; marié à un tailleur.Minata a cinq enfants dont trois garçons et deux filles et tous vont à l’école. L’âge des enfants se situe entre 6 et 17 ans. L’emprunteur a pour rêve d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants, leur habillement et leur nourriture.
Son espoir est de réussir dans l’élevage ovin et le petit commerce informel. Minata fait recourt au RMCR pour avoir plus d’argent et acheter plus de moutons d’élever qui lui procurera plus de bénéfice pour soutenir ses enfant et aider son mari aux charges de la famille. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés locaux environnent et revend dans les même marchés. Minata emprunte l’argent pour acheter plus de moutons.
texts.en:
Minata is the woman holding the sheep in her hand [in the photo]. She is a Malian livestock farmer, who is 55 years old and married to a tailor. She has been a farmer for more than ten years. Minata cannot read or write. She has five children, of whom three are boys and two are girls, aged from six to 17 years old. All of the children are in school.

This borrower dreams of ensuring her children's education, along with their clothing and food needs. She hopes to succeed with her work raising sheep and conducting informal small-scale commerce.

Minata joined RMCR so she could have more money to buy more sheep to raise, which will lead to more earnings for supporting her children and helping her husband with the family expenses.

She procures her livestock in the local surrounding markets, and resells them in the same markets. She is borrowing the money to buy more sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise and resell

loans.name: Karyango

texts.en:
Karyango is 49-years-old. He is married with 5 children, ages between 7 and 18-years-old. They all go to school. He has farmed for 7 years. With the Kiva loan, he would like to buy a cooling tank and milk for sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumptions and pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy a cooling tank and milk for sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es: La señora Angelina, es una persona sencilla, humilde, muy trabajadora y responsable para su familia. Es casada y tiene 4 hijos pequeños que dependen económicamente de ellos, por diversas circunstancias de la vida solo llego a estudiar  hasta el nivel primario. Actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos la misma que es de construcción rustica. La señora se dedica a la producción y venta de cultivos agrícolas como ser papa, zanahoria y haba en vaina verde en su terreno propio. Angelina junto a su esposo desean ampliar la producción de papa este año, para lo cual necesitan de apoyo económico para lograr este objetivo y de esta manera poder tener una mejor producción que a un mediano plazo pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos y beneficie a su familia más que todo en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Mrs. Angelina is an unpretentious, humble woman, responsible for her family. She is married with 4 small children who depend on them. For various circumstances in life, she only studied through elementary school. She currently lives in her own house with her husband and children, which is built in a rustic manner. She works growing agricultural products such as potatoes, carrots, and lima beans in her own lot. Angelina and her husband want to expand their potato production this year, thus they need economic support for this purpose. This way,  they could have a better production which, in a medium term, may help them improve their earnings and benefit their family, especially in the education of their children.

loans.use: To increase potato production

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
La sonriente y simpática mujer que se aprecia en la foto se llama Estela, ella es una mujer de 52 años de edad, felizmente casada y que trabaja como independiente atendiendo una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar.

Su deseo de superación, sus ganas de comprar una vivienda han llevado a esta mujer a empezar su negocio, aunque no contaba con mucha capital para la actividad, uso lo poco que tenia y puso en marcha su actividad.

Ahora que está en el mundo del conocimiento y ha sabido lo fuerte que es la competencia y lo importante de contar con un surtido amplio para que sus clientes gusten de ir a su tienda, cree que es tiempo de iniciar una arremetida para iniciar ganar terreno, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar, con este préstamo lograra abastecer sus estanterías e incluso tener productos nuevos.

Con el dinero solicitado comprara verduras, productos para el hogar, productos de aseo domestico y abarrotes.
texts.en:
The nice, smiling woman in the photo is Estela. She is a 52-year-old happily married woman and she works independently running a general store. 

Her desire to improve and to purchase a home have led this woman to start her business. Even though she didn't have much capital for the business, she used the little she had to get it going. 

Now that she has found out and is aware of the competition, and the importance of having a wide variety of goods for her customers so that they like her store, she feels it is time to start pushing to move forward. That is why she is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of basic goods. With this loan, she will manage to stock her shelves and also have new products. 

With the money requested she will purchase vegetables, household products, domestic cleaning products, and groceries.

loans.use: purchase vegetables, household products, domestic cleaning products, and groceries.

loans.name: Eloina

texts.es: La señora Eloina es una persona mayor de edad, vive con su pareja en el área rural en una casita rustica de adobe, apenas cuenta con servicios básicos pero con algunas restricciones. Solamente alcanzaron a estudiar hasta el nivel primario, la actividad principal a la que se dedican es la agricultura  y venta de sus productos, de ahí generan sus mayores ingresos económicos para sustentar a sus tres hijos y pagarles el estudio. Los productos que siembran y comercializan son: papa en mayor cantidad, haba en vaina, arveja  y otros cultivos  en pequeña cantidad que son para consumo propio. La señora Eloina se ve en la necesidad de  solicitar  un préstamo el cual le sirve como  capital de operación para la compra de abono orgánico y semillas, de esta manera continuará con su actividad agrícola para obtener mayores ingresos y seguir brindando el apoyo a sus hijos,  mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mrs. Eloina is an older person. She lives with her partner in a rural area in a rustic adobe house. She barely has basic services with a few restrictions in the house. They only studied through elementary, being their main source of income agriculture and selling their products. This is how they generate income to support their three children and pay for their studies. They primarily grow: potatoes, lima beans, peas, and other crops in small quantity which they use for their own consumption. Eloina needs to ask for a loan which serves her as capital to buy manure and seeds. This way, she will continue her farming activities and will be able to generate greater income and continue supporting their children, thus improving their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy manure and seeds, to be able to continue her work and pay for her children education.

loans.name: Marie Genevieve

texts.en:
Marie Genevieve is 41 years old and married. She has two children who are currently in school. Marie Genevieve works very hard to provide for them.

Marie Genevieve runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, candies, biscuits, soft drinks, noodles, sanitary pads, etc.  

Marie Genevieve requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, candies, biscuits, soft drinks, noodles, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.


In the future, Marie Genevieve would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, candies, biscuits, soft drinks, noodles, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothes to sell at the market

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1964. She lives in a small town with her family. She is married and has a child. She is a responsible, honest and hospitable person. She has many years of experience doing business in agriculture. She keeps livestock at home and feeds them to further her selling. Her business is well and she likes her activity. She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy livestock and enlarge her business. She hopes to be supported, because it is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy livestock and enlarge her business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia, aged 46, is a married woman with seven children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has had a vegetable vending business in the Philippines for the past 12 years. 

Amalia has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell from her vegetable stall.

In the future, Amalia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 38-years-old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nenita is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nenita has been raising pigs for 12 years and also earns additional income from a restaurant.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Apolinaria works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Apolinaria is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers for her selling vegetables business.

Apolinaria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 41 years old and works very hard to improve her business.

Arlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 2 years. She sells a variety of items such as coffee, detergent soap, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, juice, and milk. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Arlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like coffee, detergent soap, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, juice, and milk to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store.

Virginia dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell
